interpret: vt.向...谄媚，奉承，使高兴，使感到荣幸
example: 单词 flatter 的例句||||We flatter ourselves that we provide the best service in town. 我们相信我们提供的服务在本市最好。||||It turns my stomach to hear him flatter. 听到他拍马屁，我实在感到讨厌。

name: hasty
interpret: adj.草率的，急速的，匆忙的，仓促完成的
example: 单词 hasty 的例句||||She's too hasty. She should learn to think before speaking. 她太轻率了，她应该学会话出口前想一想。|||| You will have time for a hasty snack before the train leaves. 火车离站前你还能抓紧时间吃一顿快餐。

name: hail
interpret: n.雹，一阵；vi.下雹；vt.高呼，为...喝彩
example: 单词 hail 的例句||||Hail fell with such violence that it broke windows. 冰雹猛落，把玻璃窗也砸破了。||||The people lined the streets to hail the returning heroes. 人们夹道欢迎凯旋的英雄们。

name: flaw
interpret: n.缺陷，瑕疵，裂缝；vt.使有缺陷，损害
example: 单词 flaw 的例句||||The flaw in this stamp makes it less valuable. 这张邮票因为有点缺陷, 不那么值钱。||||Jealousy is a big flaw in his character. 嫉妒是他品格中的一个大缺点。

name: correspondent
interpret: n.记者，通信者；adj.符合的，一致的，相当的
example: 单词 correspondent 的例句||||He volunteered as a correspondent for the war. 他自愿担任作报道这次战争的记者。||||The result was correspondent with my wishes. 结果与我的愿望是一致的。

name: grind
interpret: n.（常贬义）用功的学生，书呆子；vt.磨，磨碎
example: 单词 grind 的例句||||Would you please grind a pound of coffee for me? 请给我磨一磅咖啡好吗？ ||||Do you find learning English a grind? 你觉得学英语是一件苦差事吗？

name: gloomy
interpret: adj.阴暗的，阴沉的，令人沮丧的，阴郁的
example: 单词 gloomy 的例句||||A few faint gleams of sunshine lit up the gloomy afternoon. 几束隐约的阳光使阴暗的下午有些明亮。|||| When I saw their gloomy faces, I knew something was wrong. 当我看到他们沮丧的脸时，我知道出事了。

name: intellect
interpret: n.理智，才智，有才智的人，知识分子
example: 单词 intellect 的例句||||Newton is a man of great intellect. 牛顿有非凡的才智。||||It is not often that one so young has such a giant intellect. 年纪这样轻、智力又如此高的人可不多。

name: dedicate
interpret: vt.献身，致力于，把（时间、精力等）用于
example: 单词 dedicate 的例句||||She vowed to herself that she would dedicate her life to scientific studies. 她默默地发誓要献身于科学研究。||||To my father I dedicate this volume in token of affection and gratitude. 我谨以此书献给我的父亲，以表示对他的爱戴和感激之情。

name: scope
interpret: n.（处理、研究事物的）范围，余地，机会
example: 单词 scope 的例句||||There is limited scope for creativity in my job. 我的工作中发挥创造力的空间有限。||||There is little scope for initiative in this job. 这工作几乎没有发挥主动性的余地。

name: preach
interpret: vi.传道，宣扬；vt. 讲道，说教
example: 单词 preach 的例句||||Don't preach me a sermon, please. 请不要对我讲大道理。||||They continue to preach their gospel of self-reliance. 他们继续倡导自立的信条。

name: enhance
interpret: vt.提高（强度、力量、数量等），增加（进）
example: 单词 enhance 的例句||||BBC backing for the scheme will enhance its credibility. 英国广播公司对这一计划的支持将提高其可信度。||||Good secretarial skills should enhance your chances of getting a job. 出色的秘书工作技能会增加你找工作的机会。

name: agreeable
interpret: adj.符合的，一致的，欣然同意的，令人愉快的
example: 单词 agreeable 的例句||||He was quite agreeable to accepting the plan. 他乐意接受这项计划。||||I enjoyed an agreeable holiday this summer. 今年夏天我度过了一个愉快的假期。

name: gracious
interpret: adj.亲切的，客气的，宽厚的，仁慈的
example: 单词 gracious 的例句||||She was a very gracious lady. 她是一位非常和蔼可亲的女士。||||She was gracious enough to show us round her home. 她彬彬有礼地领我们参观了她的家。

name: flutter
interpret: vi.振翼，飘动，快速跳动；n.紧张，激动不安
example: 单词 flutter 的例句||||Our surprise attack put the enemy into a flutter. 我们的奇袭使敌人张皇失措。||||They unfurled the flag and let it flutter in the wind. 他们将旗展开让其迎风招展。

name: wretched
interpret: adj.可怜的，不幸的，卑鄙的，质量差的，恶劣的
example: 单词 wretched 的例句||||What a wretched life they lived in the workhouse? 他们在济贫院里过的生活真悲惨？||||He was wretched when he failed the examination. 由于考试不及格，他很痛苦。

name: concede
interpret: vt.承认，容许，（比赛结束前）认输，退让
example: 单词 concede 的例句||||I concede that you are right. 我承认你是对的。||||He will not concede what anything ails his business. 他不允许任何事情来干扰他的工作。

name: deepen
interpret: vt./vi.加深，(使)变深，加重，加浓
example: 单词 deepen 的例句||||We'll have to deepen the well if we want more water. 如果我们想要更多的水，就得把井加深。||||Her wrinkles deepen with age. 她的皱纹随年龄增长而变深。

name: proposition
interpret: n.建议，命题，主张；vt.向...提议，向...调情
example: 单词 proposition 的例句||||The two teams prepared to debate the given proposition. 两个队准备就所给定的命题展开辩论。||||It is clearly illogical to maintain such a proposition. 坚持这种主张显然是没有道理的。

name: refute
interpret: vt.驳斥，反驳，证明
example: 单词 refute 的例句||||It was the kind of rumour that it is impossible to refute. 这是那种让人根本没法批驳的谣言。||||It goes without saying that we have the right to refute them publicly. 不用说我们有权公开驳斥他们。

name: brisk
interpret: adj.轻快的，生气勃勃的，（天气等）令人振作的
example: 单词 brisk 的例句||||The actress is walking at a brisk pace. 那位女演员正以轻快的步伐走着。||||It's great to work outdoors during brisk fall days. 清爽的秋日里在户外工作是很愉快的。

name: heritage
interpret: n.传统，遗产，继承物
example: 单词 heritage 的例句||||The ancient buildings are part of the national heritage. 这些古建筑是民族遗产的一部分。||||We Chinese have a great cultural heritage. 我们中国人有伟大的文化遗产。

name: alternate
interpret: adj.交替的，间隔的；v.（使）轮流
example: 单词 alternate 的例句||||He and I clean our room on alternate days. 我和他隔日轮流打扫我们的房间。||||That was a week of alternate rain and sunshine. 那是晴雨天交替的一周。

name: clarity
interpret: n.清澈，透明，明晰
example: 单词 clarity 的例句||||His writing has great clarity of style. 他的写作风格清晰易懂。||||Mozart's music is characterized by its naivety and clarity. 莫扎特的音乐特色是纯朴兴清澈。

name: soar
interpret: vi.猛增，高飞，升腾，高涨，屹立
example: 单词 soar 的例句||||The eagle can soar without flapping their wings. 老鹰无需振翼就能翱翔。||||Borrowing is set to soar to an astonishing ￡60 billion. 借款很可能猛增至惊人的600亿英镑。

name: revelation
interpret: n.泄露，揭示，展示，惊人的新发现
example: 单词 revelation 的例句||||Her true nature was a revelation to me. 她的真实性格对我是一个新发现。||||The revelation of the plot of the traitors caused their capture. 反叛者阴谋的泄露使他们被捕。

name: rejoice
interpret: vi.感到高兴，充满喜悦
example: 单词 rejoice 的例句||||We rejoice at every victory won by your people. 我们为贵国人民取得的每一个胜利都感到高兴。||||Let us rejoice together on this great occasion? 在这样一个盛大的节日里，让我们共同欢庆吧？

name: dock
interpret: n.码头；被告席；vt.使(船)进港；扣；vi.进港
example: 单词 dock 的例句||||We took the children to the dock to see the ships. 我们带孩子们到码头去看轮船。||||The corrupt official stood in the dock. 那贪官站在被告席上。

name: prolong
interpret: vt.延长，拉长，拖延
example: 单词 prolong 的例句||||He has decided to prolong his visit through the weekend. 他已决定把他的访问延长到过完周末。||||People have all along been seeking to prolong life. 人们一直在寻求长寿之道。

name: raid
interpret: v.劫掠，攫取，袭击，突击搜捕；n.突然袭击
example: 单词 raid 的例句||||Our house was blown up in an air raid. 在一次空袭中我们的房子被炸掉了。||||During their raid on the house, the police found a lot of drugs. 在对这所房子的搜查中，警方发现了大量的毒品。

name: profound
interpret: adj.深奥的，造诣深的；深度的，极度的
example: 单词 profound 的例句||||I give you my profound thanks for saving my life. 我对您的救命之恩深表谢意。||||He has a profound knowledge of mathematics. 他数学知识渊博。

name: sheer
interpret: adj.绝对的，全然的，峻峭的；v.躲开，躲避，使...避开； adv.完全，全然，峻峭
example: 单词 sheer 的例句||||He achieved his aim by sheer strength of will. 他纯粹靠意志力达到了目的。||||I guess it's sheer waste of time arguing about it. 看来争论这件事纯粹是浪费时间。

name: echo
interpret: n.回音，共鸣；vi.发出回声；vt.模仿，附和
example: 单词 echo 的例句||||She shouted on the mountaintop and listened for the echo. 她在山顶上大声喊着，然后聆听着回声。||||I should like to echo the words of the previous speaker. 我想重复前面一位发言者的话。

name: confront
interpret: vt.遭遇，勇敢地面对，正视，使对质
example: 单词 confront 的例句||||A soldier has to confront danger. 士兵须面对危险。||||We must confront future with optimism. 我们必须乐观地面对未来。

name: gleam
interpret: n./vi.微光，闪光，短暂而微弱的闪现
example: 单词 gleam 的例句||||We saw the gleam of headlights through the rain. 我们在雨中看见汽车前灯的微光。||||A gleam of interest came into his eyes. 他的眼里流露出一丝关切的目光。

name: intact
interpret: adj.完整无缺的，未经触动的，未受损伤的
example: 单词 intact 的例句||||The glasses remained intact after being dropped. 眼镜坠地后依然完好无损。||||He can scarcely survive this scandal with his reputation intact. 他经此丑闻名誉很难不受损。

name: lease
interpret: n.租约，租期，租；v.出租，租出，租得
example: 单词 lease 的例句||||When does the lease of the house run out? 这房子的租约何时到期？ ||||He signed the lease yesterday. 昨天他在租约上签了字。

name: melody
interpret: n.旋律，曲调，悦耳的音乐
example: 单词 melody 的例句||||She struck up a folk melody on the piano. 她开始用钢琴演奏那首民歌。||||After she wrote the melody, she asked us for criticisms. 她做好曲之后，请我们提意见。

name: regulate
interpret: vt.管理，控制，调节，调校，调整
example: 单词 regulate 的例句||||This system can regulate the temperature of the room. 这种系统能调节室内温度。||||They regulate the flow of water by the sluice gate. 他们用水闸门控制水的流量。

name: pilgrim
interpret: n.香客，朝圣者；v.朝圣，参拜圣地，流浪
example: 单词 pilgrim 的例句||||They read stories about the Indians and the pilgrim. 他们阅读有关印第安人和那些朝圣者的故事。||||But one man loved the pilgrim soul in you. 只有一个人爱你那朝圣者的灵魂。

name: signify
interpret: vt.表示...的意思，意味，预示
example: 单词 signify 的例句||||State ownership in itself does not signify collective control. 国家所有本身并不意味集体控制。||||The striped band round a policeman's sleeve is to signify that he is on duty. 警察袖子上的袖标标明他正在执勤。

name: statesman
interpret: n.国务活动家，政治家
example: 单词 statesman 的例句||||Friends gathered at a memorial for the late statesman. 这位已故政治家的生前好友为他举行了纪念仪式。||||The statesman is much occupied with affairs of state. 那个政治家忙于国事。

name: violate
interpret: vt.违反，违背，亵渎，侵犯，妨碍
example: 单词 violate 的例句||||Those who violate traffic regulations should be punished. 那些违反交通规定的人应该受处罚。||||Can they be allowed to violate rules and regulations at will? 难道能容许他们随心所欲地破坏规章制度吗？

name: weary
interpret: adj.疲劳的，使人疲劳的；vi.厌烦，不耐烦
example: 单词 weary 的例句||||He has laid out all his strength and is weary. 他使出了全部气力，非常疲倦。||||I am weary of his constant complaints. 我对他不断发牢骚感到厌烦。

name: convention
interpret: n.惯例，习俗，常规，会议，大会
example: 单词 convention 的例句||||How many delegates have checked in at the convention? 大会已有多少代表报到？||||He sets at naught every convention of society. 他轻视所有的社会习俗。

name: morality
interpret: n.道德（性），德行，品行，道德观（规范）
example: 单词 morality 的例句||||Morality was the emphasis of his speech. 道德是他讲话的重点。||||He has overthrown the basic standards of morality. 他已摒弃了基本的道德标准。

name: transition
interpret: n.转变，变迁，过渡
example: 单词 transition 的例句||||Adolescence is the period of transition between childhood and adulthood. 青春期是童年与成年之间的过渡时期。||||They all support a peaceful transition. 他们全部都支持和平过渡。

name: compact
interpret: adj.紧密的，简明的，紧凑的；v.使紧凑，压缩
example: 单词 compact 的例句||||It was a compact package. 这是个捆得很紧的包裹。|||| The article is compact and well organized. 文章严密，又很有章法。

name: probability
interpret: n.可能性，可能发生的事，概率
example: 单词 probability 的例句||||The probability that it will rain today is high. 今天下雨的可能性很大。||||He must calculate the probability of failure. 他必须计算一下失败的概率。

name: purify
interpret: vt.使纯净，提纯，使纯洁
example: 单词 purify 的例句||||They open the windows to purify the air of the room. 他们打开窗户清涤室内空气。||||You should purify the water before drinking it. 喝水前，你应使之净化。

name: transmission
interpret: n.播送，发射，传送，传递，传染
example: 单词 transmission 的例句||||When the transmission is good, foreign stations can be heard. 在传送情况良好时，以收到外国电台。|||| The letter was delayed in transmission. 这封信在传递中被耽误了。

name: deliberate
interpret: adj.故意的，深思熟虑的；v.仔细考虑
example: 单词 deliberate 的例句||||You should deliberate over the question before you respond to it. 回答问题之前你应该慎重考虑。|||| His actions were clearly the result of deliberate calculation. 他的行动显然是精心策划过的。

name: overhear
interpret: vt.无意中听到，偷听到
example: 单词 overhear 的例句||||I happened to overhear what he said. 我碰巧听到他说的话。||||They stepped aside so that their child could not overhear their conversation. 他们走到一边去，不让孩子听见他们的谈话。

name: saint
interpret: n.圣徒；基督教徒；vt.成为圣徒，把...视为圣徒
example: 单词 saint 的例句||||He was made a saint. 他被封为圣人。||||The saint had a lowly heart. 圣人有谦诚之心。

name: offensive
interpret: adj.令人不快的，侮辱的，攻击用的；n.进攻
example: 单词 offensive 的例句||||His mode of doing business is offensive to me. 他干事情的方式叫我很不喜欢。||||If all else fails, I will take the offensive. 如果其他方法不行，我将采取攻势。

name: deficiency
interpret: n.缺乏，不足，缺点，缺陷
example: 单词 deficiency 的例句||||During the war children suffered from a deficiency of food. 战争期间孩子们遭受缺乏食物之苦。||||Fortunately, color deficiency is not a serious medical problem. 幸运的是，色盲并不是一种严重的医学问题。

name: entrepreneur
interpret: n.企业家，主办人
example: 单词 entrepreneur 的例句||||The entrepreneur has become a news figure. 这位企业家变成了新闻人物。||||The entrepreneur takes business risks in the hope of making a profit. 企业家为追求利润而冒险。

name: fraud
interpret: n.骗子，欺骗，欺诈，诡计
example: 单词 fraud 的例句||||We will introduce legal safeguards against fraud. 我们将推行防止欺诈的法律条款。||||The prosecutor accused the defendant of fraud. 原告控告被告犯有欺诈罪。

name: pose
interpret: vt.造成，陈述；vi.摆姿势，装腔作势；n.姿势
example: 单词 pose 的例句||||He sat in a relaxed pose. 他轻松自如地坐着。||||He always strikes such a dignified pose before his girlfriend. 他总是在女友面前摆出这种庄严的姿态。

name: suppress
interpret: vt.压制，镇压，查禁，抑制，阻止
example: 单词 suppress 的例句||||He continued to suppress the people and serve the imperialists. 他继续镇压人民，为帝国主义效劳。||||She was struggling to suppress her sobs. 她拼命不让自己哭出来。

name: warrant
interpret: n.正当理由，根据，委任状，准许；vt.保证，辩解，担保，授权
example: 单词 warrant 的例句||||I will warrant him an honest and reliable fellow. 我可以保证他是一个诚实可靠的人。||||The commissioner has issued a warrant for her arrest. 专员发出了对她的逮捕令。

name: rally
interpret: n.集会，公路汽车赛；v.集合，恢复，振作
example: 单词 rally 的例句||||The grand mass rally was held on the square. 广场上举行了盛大的群众集会。||||The team captain vainly tried to rally his troops. 队长试图振作部队的士气，但没有成功。

name: sober
interpret: adj.清醒的，沉着冷静的，稳重的，颜色暗淡的；vt.使清醒，使沉着；vi.清醒，冷静下来
example: 单词 sober 的例句||||He talked to us in a sober friendly fashion. 他以冷静而又友好的方式同我们交谈。||||The man was still sober when he went home. 那人回到家时头脑依然清醒。

name: sensitivity
interpret: n.敏感（性），灵敏（度）
example: 单词 sensitivity 的例句||||Hearing sensitivity declines with age. 听觉因年老而衰退。||||Such is the sensitivity of the information that only two people are allowed to know it. 这信息极为敏感，只允许两个人知道。

name: revenue
interpret: n.总收入，财政收入，税收；税务局
example: 单词 revenue 的例句||||The country diminished the revenue by reducing tax. 这个国家通过减税而使税收减少了。||||A government's revenue and expenditure should be balanced. 政府的财政收入和支出要平衡。

name: verbal
interpret: adj.口头的，用言辞的，用文字的，动词的
example: 单词 verbal 的例句||||Verbal statements are no guarantee. 口说无凭。||||I delivered a verbal protest against their brutal acts. 我对他们的暴行提出口头抗议。

name: astronomy
interpret: n.天文学
example: 单词 astronomy 的例句||||Mathematics is connected with astronomy. 数学与天文学有联系。||||Astronomy is an abstract subject. 天文学是一门深奥的学科。

name: finance
interpret: n.财务管理，财政，金融，财源，资金
example: 单词 finance 的例句||||She is an expert in finance. 她是一名财政专家。|||| A finance house made a bid to buy up the entire company. 一家信贷公司出价买下了整个公司。

name: ivory
interpret: n.象牙，乳白色；adj.象牙制的，乳白色的
example: 单词 ivory 的例句||||My grandmother has some jewelry made of ivory. 我祖母有一些象牙首饰。||||It is carved from ivory. 它是用象牙雕成的。

name: orchestra
interpret: n.管弦乐队；vt.命令，定购
example: 单词 orchestra 的例句||||He plays the violin in an orchestra. 他在管弦乐队中演奏小提琴。||||I was tempted to stay and hear this superb orchestra rehearse. 我真想留下来听这支高超的管弦乐队排练。

name: species
interpret: n.物种，种群
example: 单词 species 的例句||||Are we the only thinking species in the whole of creation? 我们是万物中惟一有思想的物种吗？||||This species of bird now exists only in Africa. 这种鸟现在只存在于非洲。

name: enrich
interpret: vt.充实，使丰富，使富裕，使富有
example: 单词 enrich 的例句||||Some cream will enrich the sauce. 在调味汁里加一些奶油会使其味道更加丰富。||||Music can enrich your life. 音乐能丰富你的生活。

name: usage
interpret: n.惯用法，使用，用法
example: 单词 usage 的例句||||I am clear about the usage of this word at last. 这个词的用法我算是弄明白了。||||The usage is now firmly established. 这种用法现已得到确认。

name: accommodate
interpret: vt.容纳，向...提供住处，使适应，顺应
example: 单词 accommodate 的例句||||You should soon accommodate yourself to the new circumstance. 你应尽快适应新环境。||||Are there enough shelves to accommodate all our books? 有足够的书架容纳我们所有的书吗？

name: acquisition
interpret: n.取得，学到，养成（习惯），获得的东西
example: 单词 acquisition 的例句||||The children progressed in the acquisition of basic skills. 孩子们在掌握基本技术方面取得了进步。|||| He devotes his time to the acquisition of knowledge. 他把时间都花在求知上。

name: adore
interpret: vt.崇拜，敬慕，爱慕，非常喜欢
example: 单词 adore 的例句||||People adore him for his noble character. 人们因他的高贵品质而敬爱他。||||I would adore to settle back homeland. 我非常喜欢回家乡定居。

name: ambassador
interpret: n.大使，特使，（派驻国际组织的）代表
example: 单词 ambassador 的例句||||He took up office as an ambassador for ten years continuously. 他连任十年大使。||||The new ambassador is more mature than his predecessor. 新大使比他的前任更成熟一些。

name: apparent
interpret: adj.表面上的，貌似真实的，显然的，明明白白的
example: 单词 apparent 的例句||||The apparent truth was really a lie. 表面上看似实话，实际上是个谎言。||||His guilt is apparent to all. 他的罪恶尽人皆知。

name: assumption
interpret: n.假定，臆断，担任，承担
example: 单词 assumption 的例句||||We mistook assumption that the price would fall. 我们错误地认为价格会下降。||||I would question the validity of that assumption. 我会质疑那个假设的正当性。

name: decline
interpret: n.衰微，跌落，下降；vt.使降低，婉谢；vi.下降，衰落，偏斜
example: 单词 decline 的例句||||I must decline to show favour to any of the candidates. 我必须拒绝偏袒任何一位候选人。||||The birthrate is on the decline. 出生率在下降。

name: bait
interpret: n.饵，引诱物；vt.用饵引诱，折磨，奚落
example: 单词 bait 的例句||||The fish took the bait. 鱼吞饵了。||||They are too knowing to bite at such a bait. 他们很老练，不上这种当。

name: barren
interpret: adj.贫瘠的，不（生）育的，没有结果的
example: 单词 barren 的例句||||The place used to be a stretch of barren land. 早先这里是一片不毛之地。||||The barren land could produce little food. 那贫瘠的土地几乎不长庄稼。

name: distinguish
interpret: vt.区别，辩明，识别，辨认出；vi.区别，辨别，识别
example: 单词 distinguish 的例句||||It is not easy to distinguish cultured pearls from genuine pearls. 辨别真正的珍珠与养殖的珍珠不容易。||||Some people find it difficult to distinguish right from wrong. 一些人认为很难辨对与错。

name: drawback
interpret: n.缺点，欠缺，不利条件
example: 单词 drawback 的例句||||Everything has its drawback. 事事不免有缺点。||||He felt the apartment's only drawback was that it was too small. 他觉得这个公寓唯一的缺点就是太小了。

name: broaden
interpret: vi. 扩大，变阔；变宽，加宽 vt. 使扩大；使变宽
example: 单词 broaden 的例句||||We broaden in experiences by traveling. 旅行增长我们的经验。||||Let's broaden out the discussion to talk about education as a whole. 我们来扩大一下讨论范围，全面谈谈教育问题。

name: competitive
interpret: adj.竞争的，比赛的，好竞争的，有竞争力的
example: 单词 competitive 的例句||||Some kinds of business are competitive. 有些商业是要竞争的。||||These businessmen are both competitive and honourable. 这些商人既有竞争性又很诚实。

name: fascinate
interpret: vt.强烈地吸引，迷住
example: 单词 fascinate 的例句||||I am extremely fascinate by the story. 这故事令我非常人迷。||||I am quite fascinate by his adventure in Africa. 他在非洲的冒险活动使人着了迷。

name: exceptional
interpret: adj.优越的，杰出的，例外的，独特的，异常的
example: 单词 exceptional 的例句||||He is a man of exceptional talent. 他是位具有非凡才能的人。||||He showed exceptional musical ability. 他显示出特殊的音乐才能。

name: identification
interpret: n.视为同一，证明同一，确认
example: 单词 identification 的例句||||He's made a formal identification of the body. 他正式确认了死者身份。||||We should have identification card on the person when we go out. 我们外出时应随身携带身份证。

name: maintenance
interpret: n.维修，保养，扶养费，维持，保持
example: 单词 maintenance 的例句||||His small farm provides maintenance, but not much more. 他的小农场能使他们维持生活，但仅此而已。||||He has to pay maintenance to his ex-wife. 他必须给前妻赡养费。

name: outcome
interpret: n.结果，出口，演变
example: 单词 outcome 的例句||||The outcome of the experiment is in the lap of the gods. 实验结果尚难预料。||||The outcome of the war is hard to foretell. 战争胜负难以预卜。

name: personnel
interpret: n.[总称]人员，员工，人事部门
example: 单词 personnel 的例句||||The personnel are not happy to change these rules. 全体工作人员对改变这些规定很不高兴。||||Personnel has lost my tax forms. 人事部门把我的税收表格给弄丢了。

name: tone
interpret: n.语气，音调，气度，色调；vt.（up）增强
example: 单词 tone 的例句||||There was a tone of mockery in his voice. 他说话的语气含有嘲笑的意味。||||Holmes used an informal, chatty tone in his essays. 霍姆斯在文章中语气轻松随便。

name: spokesman
interpret: n.发言人，代言人
example: 单词 spokesman 的例句||||The government spokesman gave a quick briefing to the reporters. 政府发言人向记者们作了情况简介。|||| They drew lots to decide who should be their spokesman. 他们抽签决定谁是他们的发言人。

name: whereas
interpret: conj.而，却，反之
example: 单词 whereas 的例句||||They want a house, whereas we would rather live in a flat. 他们想要一座房子，而我们宁愿住在一套房间里。||||Some praise him, whereas others condemn him. 有些人赞扬他，而有些人谴责他。

name: byte
interpret: n.[计]字节，比特
example: 单词 byte 的例句||||A byte composed of three binary element. 一个字节由三个二进制位组成。||||Eight bits make a byte. 八比特构成一字节。

name: define
interpret: vt.解释，下定义，阐述，限定，规定
example: 单词 define 的例句||||Please define the words. 请解释这些字的意义。|||| It's hard to define exactly what has changed. 很难解释清楚到底发生了什么变化。

name: electronics
interpret: n.电子器件，电子学，电子技术
example: 单词 electronics 的例句||||About 45000 people worked in electronics in Scotland. 苏格兰约有4. 5万人在电子行业工作。||||He wants to brush up his knowledge of electronics. 他想温习他的电子学知识。

name: creation
interpret: n.创造，创造的作品，产物，宇宙，天地万物
example: 单词 creation 的例句||||Language is the most important mental creation of man. 语言是人类头脑最重要的产物。||||The creation of new playgrounds will benefit the local children. 新游戏场的建立将有益于当地的儿童。

name: greed
interpret: n.贪食，贪心，贪婪
example: 单词 greed 的例句||||His greed knows no limits. 他的贪心永无止境。|||| Greed was his only motive for stealing. 贪婪是他盗窃的唯一动机。

name: perception
interpret: n.感知，感觉，觉察(力)；认识，观念，看法
example: 单词 perception 的例句||||What's your perception of the matter? 你对此事有什么看法？||||He was a man of keen perception. 他是一个感觉敏锐的人。

name: reproduce
interpret: vt. 复制；再生；生殖；使…在脑海中重现 vi. 复制；繁殖
example: 单词 reproduce 的例句||||The machine can reproduce a key in two minutes. 这机器能在两分钟内复制一把钥匙。||||The picture will reproduce well. 这照片会印得很清楚。

name: recognition
interpret: n.承认，认可，认出，认识
example: 单词 recognition 的例句||||The place has changed beyond recognition. 这地方变得认不出来了。||||A sudden smile of recognition flashed across his face. 他脸上掠过一丝笑意，表示认识对方。

name: revenge
interpret: n. 报复；复仇 vt. 报复；替…报仇；洗雪 vi. 报仇；雪耻
example: 单词 revenge 的例句||||She poisoned his mind with ideas of hate and revenge. 她用复仇的思想来毒害他的心灵。||||There was anger in his eyes and revenge in his heart. 他两眼闪现怒火，一心只想复仇。

name: productive
interpret: adj.能生产的，有生产价值的，多产的
example: 单词 productive 的例句||||We had a productive meeting that solved some problems. 我们开了一个富有成效的会议，解决了一些问题。||||Science and technology are part of the productive forces. 科学技术是生产力。

name: blush
interpret: vi.脸红，羞愧，觉得难为情；n.脸红，难为情
example: 单词 blush 的例句||||His remark brought a blush into the girl's cheeks. 他的话使这姑娘两颊红晕。||||I have to blush to admit that thing. 我不得不羞愧地承认了那件事。

name: charter
interpret: n.特许状，执照，宪章；v.特许，发给特许执照
example: 单词 charter 的例句||||This new law amounts to a tax evader's charter. 这项新法律简直成了为逃税者开的许可证。||||We will charter a steamer to convey the goods. 我们将租一艘船运送这批货物。

name: senator
interpret: n.参议员，评议员
example: 单词 senator 的例句||||The senator urged against the adoption of the measure. 那参议员极力反对采取这项措施。||||The senator's speech hit at government spending. 参议员的讲话批评了政府的开支。

name: veto
interpret: n.否决权；v.否决；vi.否决，禁止；vt.使用否决权
example: 单词 veto 的例句||||The President has the power of veto. 总统有否决权。||||Father put a veto upon our staying out late. 父亲不许我们在外面逗留太晚。

name: resemblance
interpret: n.相似之处，雷同之处
example: 单词 resemblance 的例句||||Kehr bears a strong facial resemblance to her sister. 凯尔的容貌和她姐姐十分相像。||||Any resemblance of a character in this book to a living person is purely incidental. 书中人物如有雷同，纯属巧合。

name: surge
interpret: n.汹涌，澎湃；vi.汹涌，强烈感到，飞涨；vt.放开，松手
example: 单词 surge 的例句||||The surge travelled southwards along the coast. 浪涛沿着海岸向南涌去。||||It failed to stimulate a surge of investment in industry. 这没有能刺激工业投资的激增。

name: representation
interpret: n.表现某人（或某事物）的东西，图画，雕塑
example: 单词 representation 的例句||||The painting is a representation of a storm at sea. 这幅画描绘的是海上的暴风雨。||||All parties won representation in the national assembly. 所有政党在国民大会中都赢得了代表资格。

name: spectacle
interpret: n.（大规模）场面，壮观[pl.]眼镜
example: 单词 spectacle 的例句||||She was fascinated at the spectacle of a rocket launching. 她被发射火箭的壮观场面强烈地吸引住了。|||| The opening ceremony was a fine spectacle. 开幕式典礼是个壮观的场面。

name: characterize
interpret: vt. 描绘…的特性；具有…的特征 vi. 塑造人物
example: 单词 characterize 的例句||||We ordinarily characterize an action as responsible if it was intended. 如果行为是有意的，我们一般将其特征归为应负责任的。||||We may characterize an atomic state by a quantum number L. 我们可以用量子数L描写一个原子的状态。

name: descent
interpret: n.下降，下倾，斜坡，坡道，血统，世系
example: 单词 descent 的例句||||We watched anxiously during her descent from the tree. 我们焦急地看着她从树上爬下来。||||Many Americans are of English descent. 许多美国人的祖籍是英国。

name: exert
interpret: vt.用（力），尽（力），运用，发挥，施加
example: 单词 exert 的例句||||He likes to exert his authority. 他喜欢行使自己的权力。||||We must exert ourselves to catch up with them, or it would be too late. 我们要急起直追，否则就太晚了。

name: enlighten
interpret: vt.启发，启蒙; 开导，教导; 〈古〉照耀
example: 单词 enlighten 的例句||||Can you enlighten her on this subject? 对这个问题你能启发启发她吗？||||Please enlighten me with your instructions. 请不吝赐教。

name: assault
interpret: v.猛烈地攻击，袭击；n.突然而猛烈的攻击
example: 单词 assault 的例句||||She appeared in court on charges of kidnapping and assault. 她因受到拐骗和侵犯人身的指控而出庭。|||| The trainees were put through an assault course. 受训人员接受了突击训练课程。

name: originate
interpret: vi.起源于，来自；vt.创造，创始，开创
example: 单词 originate 的例句||||All carbohydrates originate from plants. 所有的碳水化合物均来自植物。||||All theories originate from practice and in turn serve practice. 任何理论都来源于实践，反过来为实践服务。

name: patrol
interpret: n. 巡逻；巡逻队；侦察队 vt. 巡逻；巡查 vi. 巡逻；巡查
example: 单词 patrol 的例句||||They attacked two soldiers on patrol. 他们袭击了两名正在巡逻的士兵。||||Policemen patrol the streets. 警察在街上巡逻。

name: pastime
interpret: n.消遣，娱乐
example: 单词 pastime 的例句||||Playing chess is his favourite pastime. 下棋是他最喜爱的消遣。||||Baseball is the national pastime. 棒球是全民性的休闲运动。

name: misfortune
interpret: n.不幸，厄运，逆境，不幸事故，灾难
example: 单词 misfortune 的例句||||It is said to be an omen of misfortune. 那被认为是一种不幸的先兆。||||She had the misfortune to break her leg. 她不幸摔断了腿。

name: flock
interpret: n.羊群，一群，大量；vi.群集，聚集，成群
example: 单词 flock 的例句||||A flock of customers were waiting for the store to open. 一群顾客在等候着商店开门。||||A few sheep have been lost from the flock. 羊群里少了几只羊。

name: descendant
interpret: n.子孙，后裔，弟子
example: 单词 descendant 的例句||||He is a descendant of Confucius. 他是孔子后裔。||||He is a lineal descendant of the company's founder. 他是公司创始人的直系后裔。

name: slum
interpret: n.贫民窟，贫民区；vi.（因好奇而）逛贫民区
example: 单词 slum 的例句||||These children came from a slum area. 这些孩子来自贫民窟区。||||What a wretched existence the people in the slum lead? 这个贫民窟里的人们过着多么令人悲惨的生活啊？

name: aviation
interpret: n.航空，航空学，飞机制造业
example: 单词 aviation 的例句||||Ten years ago, they began to develop the aviation. 十年前, 他们开始发展航空工业。||||Pilots of large aircraft are masters of aviation. 大型飞行器的驾驶员是航空学方面的专家。

name: avail
interpret: vt.有益于；n.效用
example: 单词 avail 的例句||||We tried to keep him alive but to no avail. 我们全力抢救他，但却徒劳无功。||||We opposed the proposal but to no avail. 我们反对这个提议，但没用。

name: attorney
interpret: n.（业务或法律事务上的）代理人，辩护律师
example: 单词 attorney 的例句||||He acted as attorney for me. 他充当我的律师。||||The attorney for the union accused the Mayor of playing politics. 工会的律师谴责市长在这次罢工中耍阴谋。

name: attendance
interpret: n.出席，出席人数，护理，照料
example: 单词 attendance 的例句||||The attendance of this class never dropped off. 这个班的出席人数从未下降。||||The young man danced attendance on his rich aunt. 这个年轻人小心侍候他有钱的姑妈。

name: assert
interpret: vt.断言，声称，维护，坚持
example: 单词 assert 的例句||||I choose rather to hesitate my opinion than to assert it roundly. 我宁可犹疑地表示我的意见而不愿直率地断言这件事。||||You must assert yourself or they will continue to bully you. 你必须维护自己的权利，否则他们还会欺负你。

name: ascribe
interpret: vt.(to)把...归因于；把...归属于
example: 单词 ascribe 的例句||||I would not ascribe vice to him. 我不愿意把罪过归给他。||||You can't ascribe the same meaning to both words. 不要认为这两个词的意思是相同的。

name: array
interpret: n.展示，排列，盛装；vt.排列，打扮
example: 单词 array 的例句||||He was unable to escape the array of facts. 他无法躲避一连串的事实。||||She puts on her finest array. 她穿上最漂亮的衣服。

name: vulgar
interpret: adj.粗野的，下流的，庸俗的，粗俗的
example: 单词 vulgar 的例句||||His language is a bit vulgar at times. 他说话有时有点粗俗。||||His vulgar manners shocked everyone. 他粗俗的举止使大家大为吃惊。

name: arc
interpret: n.弧形（物），弧，电弧，弧光
example: 单词 arc 的例句||||The sun appears to move in an arc across the sky. 太阳看起来在天空中以弧形运行。||||The rainbow described an arc in the dark sky. 彩虹在昏暗的天空划出了一道圆弧。

name: apt
interpret: adj.易于，有...倾向，恰当的，聪明的
example: 单词 apt 的例句||||Beginners are too apt to make mistakes in grammar. 初学者极易犯语法错误。||||He is the most apt of all pupils. 他是所有学生中最聪明的一个。

name: void
interpret: n.空虚，空白，真空；adj.空的，缺乏的，无效的；vt.清空，释放，取消，离开；vi.排泄
example: 单词 void 的例句||||Suddenly the street was void of people. 街道上突然间空无一人。||||The treaty has been declared void. 条约被宣布无效。

name: whilst
interpret: conj.一边...一边，当...的时候，同时，时时
example: 单词 whilst 的例句||||She sang whilst she worked. 她边干活边唱歌。||||There was dead silence in the court, whilst the white rabbit read out these verses. 当白兔子念诗的时候，法庭上鸦雀无声。

name: whereby
interpret: adv.靠什么，靠那个
example: 单词 whereby 的例句||||Whereby shall we know her? 我们靠什么认出她呢？ |||| Whereby I saw that he was angry. 由那一点我看出他生气了。

name: wedge
interpret: n.楔子，楔形物；vt.楔住，嵌，挤进；vi.被卡住
example: 单词 wedge 的例句||||Put a wedge under the door so that it will stay open. 在门下面插个楔,，好让门开着。||||The box won't wedge into such a narrow space. 那盒无法塞进那么小的地方去。

name: waver
interpret: n.动摇，踌躇，挥动者，烫发器；v.摆动，摇曳，犹豫，颤抖，蹒跚
example: 单词 waver 的例句||||They are waver of flags and shouters of slogans. 他们都是些摇旗呐喊的人。||||This caused them to waver in their faith. 这使他们的信仰动摇了。

name: vigorous
interpret: adj.有力的，用力的，精力充沛的
example: 单词 vigorous 的例句||||The old man is still vigorous and lively. 那老人依然精力充沛。||||She had a vigorous opponent. 她遇到一个劲敌。

name: watertight
interpret: adj.不透水的，防水的，无懈可击的
example: 单词 watertight 的例句||||The ship's hold is built in watertight compartments. 船舱建造成许多不漏水的隔间。||||You know how we like to make our little boxes watertight. 您知道，我们多希望我们的小盒子滴水不漏。

name: vicious
interpret: adj.恶毒的，恶意的，凶残的，剧烈的，严重的
example: 单词 vicious 的例句||||He gave the dog a vicious blow with his stick. 他朝着那只狗狠狠地打了一棍子。||||The author portrayed his father as a vicious drunkard. 作者把他父亲描绘成一个可恶的酒鬼。

name: vicinity
interpret: n.邻近，附近地区
example: 单词 vicinity 的例句||||He told us there was no hotel in the vicinity. 他告诉我们说附近没有旅馆。||||There's a factory in the vicinity of the school. 学校邻近有个工厂。

name: timely
interpret: adj.及时的，适时的；adv.及时地
example: 单词 timely 的例句||||We are particularly grateful to him for his timely help. 我们特别感谢他的及时帮助。||||Your arrival was most timely yesterday. 你们昨天来得非常及时。

name: intent
interpret: adj.急切的，专心的，专注的；n.意图，意向
example: 单词 intent 的例句||||He was intent on the job he was doing. 他专心致志于正在做的工作。||||His plan is incompatible with my intent. 他的计划与我的意图不相符。

name: numerical
interpret: adj.数字的，用数字表示的，数值的
example: 单词 numerical 的例句||||The numbers are in numerical order. 这些号码是按数字顺序排列的。||||Modern life is numerical. 现代生活是数字化的。

name: intricate
interpret: adj.错综复杂的，复杂精细的
example: 单词 intricate 的例句||||We were able to thread but slowly through the intricate reports. 我们能弄懂这些复杂的报告，只是很慢。||||The plot of the novel is intricate and fascinating. 这部小说的情节错综复杂，引人入胜。

name: divine
interpret: adj.神的，上帝的，神圣的，如神的，非凡的
example: 单词 divine 的例句||||Jesus is believed by Christians to have been divine. 基督教徒们相信耶稣是神。||||The despot claimed to be the chosen instrument of divine providence. 专制者声称自己是上天选定的统治工具。

name: illusion
interpret: n.幻想，错误的观念，错觉，幻觉，假象
example: 单词 illusion 的例句||||The sun appears to go round the Earth, but it's an illusion. 太阳看起来好像绕着地球转，但这只是个错觉。||||They were under the illusion that the company was doing well. 他们误以为该公司生意很好。

name: jerk
interpret: n.（口语）笨蛋，性情古怪的人，急拉，肌肉抽搐；v.痉挛，急拉，急推，急动
example: 单词 jerk 的例句||||Just keep that jerk off me. 让那个笨蛋离开我。||||The knife was stuck but she pulled it out with a jerk. 那把刀子被卡住了，她猛地一拔，把它拔了出来。

name: fuss
interpret: n.过分关心，过分体贴，大惊小怪，小题大作
example: 单词 fuss 的例句||||My mother makes a fuss of me every time I come home. 我每次回家，母亲总对我体贴备至。||||Stop all this fuss and do your homework. 别大惊小怪了，去做你的家庭作业吧。

name: angle
interpret: n.角，角度，立场，观点
example: 单词 angle 的例句||||The high jumper took off at a bad angle. 跳高运动员的起跳角度不好。||||The old house leans to the right at a dangerous angle. 那所老宅向右斜得很危险。

name: stiff
interpret: adj.严厉的，激烈的，硬的，僵直的，不灵活的
example: 单词 stiff 的例句||||There is a sheet of stiff cardboard in the drawer. 在那个抽屉里有块硬纸板。||||You have to push on the handle to turn it, becanse it's very stiff. 手柄很不灵活，你必须用力推才能转动它。

name: exclusive
interpret: adj.不包括的，不算在内的，独有的，独享的
example: 单词 exclusive 的例句||||The hotel charges 6 pounds a day, exclusive of meals. 这家旅馆一天收六英镑，不包括饭钱。||||This bathroom is for the President's exclusive use. 这间浴室是总统专用的。

name: fracture
interpret: v.（使）断裂，（使）折断；n.裂缝，裂痕，折断
example: 单词 fracture 的例句||||Perhaps there is a fracture in the water pipe. 也许水管有裂缝了。||||A doctor can reduce a fracture or dislocation. 医生能使骨折或脱臼复位。

name: thereafter
interpret: adv.此后，以后
example: 单词 thereafter 的例句||||Thereafter they did not speak. 此后他们就不再讲话了。||||On the opening day all tickets are a dollar, thereafter, they'll be two dollars. 开张那天票价一元，以后两元。

name: plea
interpret: n.恳求，申诉，请愿，抗辩，借口
example: 单词 plea 的例句||||The naughty boy left the classroom on the plea of a headache. 那淘气的男孩借口头疼，离开了教室。||||In making that plea he will breathe in vain. 他做那种恳求是白费口舌的。

name: trigger
interpret: n.触发器，板机，制滑机；v.触发（事件）
example: 单词 trigger 的例句||||His index finger tightened on the trigger but then relaxed again. 他的食指扣住扳机，然后又松开了。||||He pulled the trigger but the gun didn't go off. 他打了一枪，没有发火。

name: dwell
interpret: vi.老是想着，详细讲述
example: 单词 dwell 的例句||||Sometimes his mind would dwell on the horrors he had been through. 有时他会老是想着他所经历过的种种恐怖。||||A great number of water fowls dwell on the island. 许多水鸟在岛上栖息。

name: vanity
interpret: n.虚荣心，浮华，无价值的东西；adj.虚荣心的
example: 单词 vanity 的例句||||A man's vanity is actually in proportion to his ignorance. 一个人的虚荣心实际上是和他的愚蠢程度成正比。||||Vanity and virtue do not go together. 虚荣与美德不是共生物。

name: dismay
interpret: n.灰心，沮丧，惊愕；vt.使沮丧，使惊愕
example: 单词 dismay 的例句||||The enemy retreated in perfect dismay. 敌人沮丧地退去。||||I am filled with dismay at the news. 我对这个消息极为震惊。

name: perpetual
interpret: adj.永久的，长期的，无休止的
example: 单词 perpetual 的例句||||He is on a perpetual search for truth. 他毕生在寻求真理。||||The wind and the water were carrying on their perpetual quarrel. 风和海水正进行着它们那永无休止的争吵。

name: resent
interpret: vt.对...表示忿恨，对...怨恨
example: 单词 resent 的例句||||I resent his dictatorial manner. 我痛恨他的独断作风。||||I resent comments on the impracticality of small cars. 我反对说小骄车不实用的说法。

name: impulse
interpret: n.（一时的）冲动，冲力，脉冲，神经冲动
example: 单词 impulse 的例句||||She wrote that letter on impulse. 她一时冲动写了这封信。||||I don't know how to resist my impulse. 我不知道怎样抑制自己的感情冲动。

name: marshal
interpret: n.元帅，总指挥，（美）执法官；vt.整理，集结
example: 单词 marshal 的例句||||The oldest general was appointed marshal of the armies. 资格最老的将军被任命为军队的元帅。||||Marshal your arguments before debating. 辩论前整理一下你的论点。

name: notion
interpret: n.概念，意念，看法
example: 单词 notion 的例句||||One common Chinese notion is that the elders ought to be respected. 中国人共有的一种观念是长者应受到尊敬。||||He had a sudden notion to visit all his relatives. 他心血来潮，突然想去拜访他所有的亲戚。

name: indulge
interpret: vt.沉溺（于），纵容，迁就，肆意从事
example: 单词 indulge 的例句||||I never indulge children with plenty of pocket money. 我从不放任子女，给他们大量零用钱。||||Everyone should indulge in fantasy on occasion. 每个人都应偶尔沉浸在想像之中。

name: miniature
interpret: adj.小型的，微小的；n.微小的模型，微型画
example: 单词 miniature 的例句||||He's giving a party in miniature on his birthday. 他生日那天将举行一个小型晚会。||||Games are real life in miniature. 游戏是现实生活的缩影。

name: insight
interpret: n.洞察力，洞悉，深刻的见解
example: 单词 insight 的例句||||Good teachers have insight into the problems of students. 好的教师能洞察学生的问题。||||The research will provide direct insight into molecular mechanisms. 这项研究将使人能够直接地了解分子的机理。

name: counterpart
interpret: n.与对方地位相当的人，与另一方作用相当物
example: 单词 counterpart 的例句||||Canada's Prime Minister is the counterpart of the U.S.President. 加拿大总理相当于美国总统。||||Night is the counterpart of day. 黑夜与白天相辅相成。

name: executive
interpret: adj.执行的，行政的；n.执行者，行政官，经理
example: 单词 executive 的例句||||A good executive usually gets on well with people. 一个好的高级管理人员通常与人们相处得很好。||||He is a man of great executive ability. 他是个具有极高管理能力的人。

name: coward
interpret: n.懦夫，胆小鬼
example: 单词 coward 的例句||||The newspapers had unjustly labelled him as a coward. 那家报纸不公正地称他为懦夫。||||I was basically a dreadful coward. 从根本上说, 我非常胆小怕事。

name: equation
interpret: n.方程式，等式，等同
example: 单词 equation 的例句||||The solution can be expressed by a mathematical equation. 答案可用一个数学方程式来表示。||||This equation is known as the ideal gas law. 这个等式被叫做理想气体定律。

name: designate
interpret: v.指明，标明，指出，指派，指定
example: 单词 designate 的例句||||Will you designate the flowers you wish? 你能说出你想要的花吗？||||There are efforts under way to designate the bridge a historic landmark. 人们正在努力将这座桥定为历史遗迹。

name: bewilder
interpret: vt.迷惑，使糊涂，使慌乱，使不知所措
example: 单词 bewilder 的例句||||So many questions bewilder me. 这样多的问题使我困惑。||||Again and again passages in his essays exasperate or bewilder. 他的文章里使人忿然或困惑的章节屡见不鲜。

name: comparable
interpret: adj.相似的，同类的，可比的，比得上的
example: 单词 comparable 的例句||||A fire is comparable with the sun, both give light and heat. 火可以和太阳相比，两者都可以发光发热。||||No horse has a speed comparable to that of his. 没有一匹马的速度能比得上他的马。

name: chill
interpret: vt.使变冷，使冷却，使沮丧；n.寒冷，风寒
example: 单词 chill 的例句||||With the chill factor, it's nearly minus forty here. 加上风寒指数，气温接近零下40度。||||The bad news cast a chill over the whole family. 这坏消息使全家人感到沮丧。

name: disgrace
interpret: n.耻辱，不光彩，丢脸的人（或事）；vt.使丢脸
example: 单词 disgrace 的例句||||You will bring disgrace on yourself by doing this. 你这样做会给自己带来耻辱。||||He is a disgrace to our school. 他是我们学校的耻辱。

name: sting
interpret: vt.激怒，刺痛，刺伤，蛰伤；n.刺痛，刺伤
example: 单词 sting 的例句||||Most flies do not sting. 大多数苍蝇不叮人。||||The scorpion has a sting that can be deadly. 蝎子有可以致命的螫针。

name: hinge
interpret: n.合页，铰链，关键；v.给...安铰链，随...而定
example: 单词 hinge 的例句||||That door can damage in the hinge very fast. 那扇门很快会在合页处损坏。||||Does not success or failure hinge on this? 成败之机，其在斯乎？

name: shipment
interpret: n.装货，装载的货物
example: 单词 shipment 的例句||||The goods are done up in bundles for shipment. 货物已打包以备装船。||||Please advise the date of shipment as soon as possible. 请尽快通知装货日期。

name: limp
interpret: adj.软弱的，无精神的，松沓的；vi.蹒跚；n.跛行
example: 单词 limp 的例句||||His limp is result of a car accident last year. 他的跛足是去年一次车祸所致的结果。||||He gave her a limp, cold handshake. 他有气无力且冷淡地与她握了一下手。

name: indignant
interpret: adj.愤怒的，愤慨的，义愤的
example: 单词 indignant 的例句||||The indignant customer complained to the manager. 那个愤怒的顾客向经理投诉。||||Even a written apology failed to placate the indignant hostess. 甚至一纸书面道歉都没能安抚这个怒气冲冲的女主人。

name: mint
interpret: n.薄荷，铸币厂；vt.铸造（硬币），创造（词）等
example: 单词 mint 的例句||||The mint makes coins. 铸币厂制造硬币。||||This candy tastes of mint. 这糖果有薄荷味。

name: colonial
interpret: adj.殖民地的，关于殖民的；n.殖民地，居民
example: 单词 colonial 的例句||||The natives were unwilling to be bent by colonial power. 土著居民不愿受殖民势力的摆布。||||The people of Africa have successfully fought against colonial rule. 非洲人民成功地反抗了殖民统治。

name: presumably
interpret: adv.据推测，大概，可能
example: 单词 presumably 的例句||||No reply from him yet, presumably he hasn't received my letter. 他没有回信，想必没有收到我的信。||||Presumably she could be trusted to find a safe place. 或许满可以相信她，找得到安全的所在。

name: notable
interpret: adj.值得注意的，著名的；n.名人，要人
example: 单词 notable 的例句||||His achievement is very notable. 他的成就是非常显著的。||||He wrote and published the essay under notable's name. 他假托名人写文章发表。

name: dictator
interpret: n.独裁者，爱发号施令的人
example: 单词 dictator 的例句||||We felt quite impotent to resist the will of the dictator. 我们感到无力抗拒独裁者的意志。||||A dictator must have a firm hand. 独裁者的手段是很厉害的。

name: span
interpret: n.跨度，跨距，范围；vt.持续，贯穿，跨越
example: 单词 span 的例句||||The time span of these documents from 1954 to 2009. 这些文件的时间跨度为1954年至2009年。||||The measurement span is determined by the higher and lower range values. 测量量程由上限值和下限值决定。

name: fling
interpret: vt.用力扔，使投身；n.尽情欢乐的一阵
example: 单词 fling 的例句||||I really must fling out all these old newspapers. 我真的该把这些旧报纸扔掉了。||||It's good to fling off heavy clothing now that spring is here. 春天到了, 脱去笨重的冬装真让人高兴。

name: slack
interpret: adj.松弛的，萧条的，懈怠的；vt.使松弛
example: 单词 slack 的例句||||Slack off those ropes there, there's a storm coming? 把那里的绳索放松，暴风雨就要来了？||||Some are hard at work and some are slack in work. 有的勤奋工作，有的则消极怠工。

name: commence
interpret: vt.开始；vi.获得学位
example: 单词 commence 的例句||||We will commence with this work. 我们将开始这项工作。||||The factory will commence full scale operation next month. 工厂将于下月开始全力生产。

name: plead
interpret: vt.辩护，恳求，提出借口；vi.辩护，反对
example: 单词 plead 的例句||||He had a good lawyer to plead his case. 他请了一位出色的律师为自己的案子辩护。||||Are you ready to plead against the case offered by the defendant? 你准备好反驳辩护人提出的问题了吗？

name: flush
interpret: vi.奔流；vt.冲洗；adj.齐平的；n.脸色，脸红
example: 单词 flush 的例句||||Father asked me to flush off the garage floor. 父亲叫我冲洗车库的地板。||||There was a flush in her cheeks. 她满脸通红。

name: detach
interpret: vt.(from)拆卸，使分开，使分离
example: 单词 detach 的例句||||We should detach good apples from bad. 我们必须把好的苹果与坏的分开。||||It's impossible to detach oneself from reality. 超脱现实是不可能的。

name: midst
interpret: n.中部，中间，当中
example: 单词 midst 的例句||||The hut is in the midst of the forest. 小屋在森林深处。||||There is a thief in our midst. 我们当中有小偷。

name: intuition
interpret: n.直觉，直观，凭直觉而知的事物
example: 单词 intuition 的例句||||I had an intuition that I would find you. 我有一种直觉，我能找到你们。||||He knew this thing by intuition. 他凭直觉了解这件事。

name: fellowship
interpret: n.伙伴关系，团体，奖学金，研究员职位
example: 单词 fellowship 的例句||||You'll lose your fellowship if you do that. 你如果做那件事就会丧失研究员职位。||||It looks that they'll be admitted to the fellowship. 看来他们要被吸收入会了。

name: tuck
interpret: n.缝摺，船尾突出部下方，食品，鼓声；vt.打摺，卷起，挤进，畅饮；vi.缝褶裥，缩拢，畅饮
example: 单词 tuck 的例句||||It was nip and tuck as to which boat would reach port first. 两条船中哪一条先进港都很难说。||||Tuck your shirt into your trousers. 把你的衬衫下摆掖进裤腰里。

name: reliance
interpret: n.信任，信赖，信心
example: 单词 reliance 的例句||||A child has reliance on his or her mother. 孩子都依赖于母亲。||||Our policy should rest on the basis of self-reliance. 我们的方针要放在自力更生的基点上。

name: respectable
interpret: n.品格高尚的人；adj.值得尊重的，人格高尚的，不少的
example: 单词 respectable 的例句||||She seems respectable enough. 她看上去挺体面的。|||| His savings were just enough to pay for a respectable funeral. 他的存款刚好够办一个体面的葬礼。

name: petty
interpret: adj.小的，琐碎的，不重要的，心胸狭窄的
example: 单词 petty 的例句||||The removal of petty restrictions has made life easier. 对一些琐碎规定的取消使生活更自在了。||||It was petty of her not to accept the apology. 她气量太小，连道歉也不接受。

name: stroll
interpret: n.闲逛，漫步；v.闲逛，漫步
example: 单词 stroll 的例句||||We are ready to take a stroll in the village. 我们准备到村里遛遛。||||I am rather fond of a solitary stroll in the country. 我颇喜欢在乡间独自徜徉。

name: subsequent
interpret: adj.后来的，随后的，继起的
example: 单词 subsequent 的例句||||The story will be continued in subsequent issues of the magazine. 小说将继续在以后几期杂志上连载。|||| Subsequent events vindicated the policy. 后来的事实证明那政策是对的。

name: handicap
interpret: n.障碍（身体或智力方面的），缺陷；vt.妨碍
example: 单词 handicap 的例句||||Losing our best player was a handicap to the team. 失去最棒的运动员对我队不利。||||His physical handicap prevented him from standing. 因为他身体残废，无法站立。

name: handbook
interpret: n.手册，便览，指南
example: 单词 handbook 的例句||||Her mother bought a handbook of English grammar for her last Sunday. 上星期天她母亲给她买了一本英语语法手册。||||None of them has got a handbook to tourists. 他们谁也没搞到旅游指南。

name: finite
interpret: adj.有限的，有限制的，限定的
example: 单词 finite 的例句||||These are the finite forms of a verb. 这些是一个动词的限定形式。||||Human understanding is finite. 人的理解力是有限的。

name: engagement
interpret: n.订婚，婚约，约定，约会
example: 单词 engagement 的例句||||I can't see you on Monday because I have a previous engagement. 星期一我不能见你，因为我有约在先。||||It was my mother's very own engagement ring. 这正是我母亲自己的订婚戒指。

name: gigantic
interpret: adj.巨大的，巨人似的
example: 单词 gigantic 的例句||||He has a gigantic appetite and eats gigantic meals. 他有很大的食量，能吃很多的食物。||||The earth may be thought of as a gigantic magnet. 整个地球可以想像为一块硕大无朋的磁石。

name: endow
interpret: vt.资助，捐赠，（with）给予，赋予
example: 单词 endow 的例句||||Endow a bed in a hospital. 资助医院一个床位。|||| Ramon had managed to endow the figurine with a primitive beauty. 拉蒙已做到给予这个人像以一种原始的美。

name: endeavor
interpret: vt.／n.努力，尽力，尝试
example: 单词 endeavor 的例句||||Thereupon, we knew, our endeavor was valuable. 于是，我们知道，我们的努力是有价值的。||||We endeavor to make our customers satisfied. 我们力图使顾客都满意。

name: empirical
interpret: adj.以经验（或观察）为依据的，经验（主义）的
example: 单词 empirical 的例句||||There is no empirical evidence to support his thesis. 他的论文缺乏实验证据的支持。||||We now have empirical evidence that the moon is covered with dust. 现在我们有实践经验证明月球上布满了灰尘。

name: generalize
interpret: vt.概括出；vi.形成概念
example: 单词 generalize 的例句||||When we use "he", we generalize for both sex. 当我们用he时，我们泛指男女。||||Since I do not know the details, I can only generalize about the matter. 由于不了解详情，我对此事只能泛泛而谈。

name: emigrate
interpret: vi.移居国外（或外地）
example: 单词 emigrate 的例句||||They planned to emigrate. 他们打算移民。||||The family decided to shake the dust off their feet and emigrate to Australia. 这一家人愤然离开，移居澳洲。

name: elevate
interpret: vt.提升职位，改善，使兴高采烈，举起
example: 单词 elevate 的例句||||Reading good books elevate one's mind. 阅读好书可提高人的心灵修养。||||Emotional stress can elevate blood pressure. 情绪压力可能会导致血压升高。

name: facilitate
interpret: vt.使容易（便利）推进，促进
example: 单词 facilitate 的例句||||Modern inventions facilitate housework. 许多现代发明便利了家务劳动。||||The new airport will facilitate the development of tourism. 新机场将促进旅游业的发展。

name: eject
interpret: vt.逐出，排斥，喷射
example: 单词 eject 的例句||||This safety invention will eject the pilot from a burning plane. 这个安全装置会把飞行员从燃烧着的飞机中弹出。||||Some ants eject formic acid when irritated. 有些蚂蚁受到刺激时会排出蚁酸。

name: deputy
interpret: n.代理人，代表，副职；adj.代理的，副的
example: 单词 deputy 的例句||||John will act as a deputy for me during my absence. 我离开期间，约翰将代理我的职务。||||She is the deputy headmistress of the school. 她是那所学校的代理校长。

name: deprive
interpret: vt.（of）夺去，剥夺，使丧失
example: 单词 deprive 的例句||||This law will deprive us of our most basic rights. 这条法律将剥夺我们最基本的权利。||||We have no right to deprive their life. 我们没有权利去剥夺它们的生命。

name: chord
interpret: n.和弦，和音，弦，心弦
example: 单词 chord 的例句||||Her speech struck a deep chord in my heart. 她的话深深地拨动了我的心弦。||||This is a chord of a circle. 这是个圆的弦。

name: denounce
interpret: vt.谴责，声讨，告发
example: 单词 denounce 的例句||||We should denounce a heresy. 我们应该公开指责异端邪说。||||He had thought to denounce or even assault this man. 他本来想要申斥，甚至痛打这个人一顿。

name: denote
interpret: vt.意思是，表示，是...的标志
example: 单词 denote 的例句||||We often denote danger by red letters. 我们常常用红字表示危险。||||The small symbols on this map denote historic places and museums. 这个地图上的小记号表示史迹与博物馆。

name: denial
interpret: n.否认；拒绝，拒绝给予
example: 单词 denial 的例句||||The newspaper printed a denial of the untrue story. 报社刊登了否认不实消息的声明。||||Her denial of my advice hurts me. 她拒绝我的忠告伤害了我。

name: delegate
interpret: n.代表，会议代表；vt.委派...为代表，授权
example: 单词 delegate 的例句||||They drafted her to serve as their delegate. 他们选她当代表。||||The Chinese people delegate their power to the People's Congress. 中国人民授权人民代表大会。

name: quarterly
interpret: adj.季度的；adv.季度地
example: 单词 quarterly 的例句||||The quarterly magazine is a periodical published every three months. 季刊是每3个月出版一次的期刊。||||The payments were made quarterly. 按季度付酬。

name: quantify
interpret: vt. 量化；为…定量；确定数量 vi. 量化；定量
example: 单词 quantify 的例句||||The cost of the fire damage is impossible to quantify. 这次火灾的损失是无法计算的。||||It's difficult to quantify the value of space exploration. 把太空探索的价值进行量化是很困难的。

name: pant
interpret: n.喘息，悸动；vt.气喘吁吁地说；vi.喘息，渴望；adj.裤子的
example: 单词 pant 的例句||||You pant after running hard for a time. 拼命跑一阵后便会觉得气短。||||When he bent over, he split his pant. 他一弯腰就把裤裆裂开了。

name: oath
interpret: n.誓言，誓约，咒骂，诅咒语
example: 单词 oath 的例句||||They swore an oath to carry out their duties faithfully. 他们宣誓忠实履行自己的职责。||||They swore an oath of loyalty to the country. 他们宣誓要报效祖国。

name: novelty
interpret: n.新奇事物，新奇（感），新颖廉价的物品
example: 单词 novelty 的例句||||My mother bought a novelty pen for me. 我妈给我买了一支新颖的笔。||||At first I enjoyed all the parties, but the novelty soon wore off. 起初我喜欢参加一切聚会，但这种新奇感很快就消失了。

name: merit
interpret: n.优点，价值，功绩，成绩；vt.值得
example: 单词 merit 的例句||||There is great merit in dealing fairly with your employees. 公正地对待你的雇员有极大好处。||||History affords us lessons that merit attention. 历史给我们提供了值得注意的借鉴。

name: notwithstanding
interpret: adv.虽然，尽管；prep.纵使；conj.虽然
example: 单词 notwithstanding 的例句||||Notwithstanding the heat of the sun we must go out. 尽管烈日当空、气温炎热，我们还得外出。||||I don't like movies, but I will go with you notwithstanding. 我不喜欢看电影，但我仍会陪你去。

name: notorious
interpret: adj.臭名昭著的，声名狼藉的
example: 单词 notorious 的例句||||He was notorious as a gambler. 他是臭名昭著的赌徒。||||His short temper had become notorious. 他的臭脾气是出了名的。

name: notify
interpret: vt.通知，告知，报告
example: 单词 notify 的例句||||The court clerk will notify the witness when and where to appear. 法院办事员将通知证人出庭的时间及地点。||||He will notify us where we are to meet. 他将通知我们在什么地方集合。

name: merchandise
interpret: n.商品，货物；v.经营，推销，销售，经商
example: 单词 merchandise 的例句||||There's no use in manufacturing an item unless you can merchandise it. 除非能够销售得出，否则生产产品就没有价值。||||Please don't handle the merchandise. 请不要摸这些商品。

name: lofty
interpret: adj.崇高的，高尚的，高耸的，极高的
example: 单词 lofty 的例句||||This mountain is lofty. 这座山极高。||||His lofty spirit has greatly attracted and activated others. 他的崇高精神大大地吸引并且激励了别人。

name: menace
interpret: vt./n.有危险性的人（或物），威胁，威吓
example: 单词 menace 的例句||||The big hole outside the house is a menace to children's safety. 房子外面的大窟窿对孩子们的安全是个威胁。||||A careless driver is a menace to all road users. 漫不经心的驾驶员对于路上所有车辆和行人都是危险的。

name: locality
interpret: n.地方，所在，位置
example: 单词 locality 的例句||||He surprised us with his knowledge of the locality. 我们很惊讶他对那地方如此了解。||||It was the locality of the crime. 这就是犯罪地点。

name: norm
interpret: n.标准，规范，平均数
example: 单词 norm 的例句||||Of his age, the child is above the norm in arithmetic. 在他那个年龄，这个孩子的算术能力是超过标准的。||||These events were aberrations from the norm. 这些事件不合常规。

name: nominate
interpret: vt.提名，推荐，任命
example: 单词 nominate 的例句||||I nominate Tom to make the tea. 我指派汤姆去沏茶。||||The EU would nominate two members to the committee. 欧盟将为该委员会指定两名成员。

name: mechanics
interpret: n.力学，机械学；结构
example: 单词 mechanics 的例句||||The mechanics of fixing a car are very long. 修理一部汽车的过程很长。||||The mechanics of the machine are very old. 这台机器的机件非常老。

name: literal
interpret: adj.照字面的，原义的，逐字的
example: 单词 literal 的例句||||This word should not be taken in its literal sense. 这个词不能按本义去理解。||||He made a literal interpretation. 他逐字解释。

name: nickel
interpret: n.镍，（美国和加拿大的）五分钱
example: 单词 nickel 的例句||||Nickel can be used for making coins. 镍可做成钱币。||||May I have a nickel? 能给我五分钱吗？

name: mast
interpret: n.船桅，桅杆，旗杆，天线杆
example: 单词 mast 的例句||||Flags are flying at half-mast across China. 全中国将半旗。||||The sails were flapping against the mast. 帆拍打着桅杆。

name: liner
interpret: n.班船，定期班机
example: 单词 liner 的例句||||They sailed to America in a large liner. 他们乘坐一艘大客轮航行到美国。||||The liner flew straight to Nanjing. 客机径直飞往南京。

name: latent
interpret: adj.潜伏的，潜在的；n.隐约的指印，指纹
example: 单词 latent 的例句||||You have latent force to develop in your studies. 你在学习上还有潜力可挖。||||Without training, his musical talent remained latent. 由于未经训练，他的音乐天赋未被发掘出来。

name: incline
interpret: v.(使)倾斜；倾向于，赞同；n.斜坡，斜面
example: 单词 incline 的例句||||I incline to his opinion on this matter. 对这件事我倾向于他的观点。||||The coach was driven to a slight incline. 马车上了一个慢坡。

name: incidence
interpret: n.发生，影响；入射
example: 单词 incidence 的例句||||The angle of incidence equals the angle of reflection. 入射角等于反射角。||||The incidence of this disease has dropped considerably in the past few years. 近几年这种病的发病率大大降低了。

name: inaugurate
interpret: vt.为..举行就职典礼，为展览会揭幕，开创
example: 单词 inaugurate 的例句||||We inaugurate a new era of customizing english teaching. 我们开创定制英语教学新时代。||||To inaugurate a new situation of spiritual civilization construction. 开创精神文明建设的新局面。

name: hoe
interpret: n.锄；v.用锄整(地)，用锄除草
example: 单词 hoe 的例句||||They hoe the garden to keep down the weeds. 他们把花园里的草锄掉，阻止其生长。||||She bought herself a hoe and a sickle. 她给自己买了一把锄头和一把镰刀。

name: hitherto
interpret: ad.迄今，到目前为止
example: 单词 hitherto 的例句||||Hitherto he had experienced no great success in his attempt. 到目前为止，他的尝试还没获得成功。||||She discovered a world of parties and pleasure she had hitherto only known by hearsay. 她发现了一个以前只是略有听闻的花花世界。

name: kidney
interpret: n.肾，腰子，类型
example: 单词 kidney 的例句||||Several of the patients had received kidney transplant. 病人中有几位已接受了肾移植手术。||||The operation to transplant a kidney is now fairly routine. 肾脏移植手术如今已相当常见。

name: impose
interpret: vt.把…强加于，加重…负担；征收(税款)
example: 单词 impose 的例句||||Don't impose yourself on people who don't like you. 不要硬缠着不喜欢你的人。||||I don't want to impose on you. 我并不想打扰你。

name: impart
interpret: vt.告知，透露；赋予，给予
example: 单词 impart 的例句||||A teacher's aim is to impart knowledge. 教师的宗旨就是传授知识。||||Your presence will impart an air of elegance to the party. 您的光临将会为宴会增添优雅的气氛。

name: immerse
interpret: vt.使沉浸在，使深陷于；使浸没在
example: 单词 immerse 的例句||||Immerse the cloth in the dye for twenty minutes. 把布浸在染料里20分钟。||||Don't immerse yourself in the infliction too long. 不要长时间沉浸在痛苦经历中。

name: imitation
interpret: n.模仿；仿制，仿制品；赝品
example: 单词 imitation 的例句||||It's not real leather. It's only an imitation. 那不是真皮，只不过是仿制品。||||Young children learn how to speak by imitation. 儿童通过模仿学说话。

name: henceforth
interpret: ad.今后，从今以后
example: 单词 henceforth 的例句||||Henceforth I expect you to be punctual for meeting. 我希望你今后准时到会。||||Henceforth his life would never be the same again. 从今以后他的生活将不再像从前一样。

name: heighten
interpret: vt.加高，提高，增高；增加，增大，加强
example: 单词 heighten 的例句||||A weakened immune system does not heighten the risks of catching a cold. 一个弱免疫系统是不会增加感冒的感染可能性的。||||We must however heighten our vigilance. 但是我们应当提高警惕。

name: ignite
interpret: vt.点燃，引发；vi.着火
example: 单词 ignite 的例句||||The rocket rises and we can see the second stage ignite. 火箭升高了，我们可以看到二级点火。||||The burning gases can ignite the lean mixture. 燃烧着的气体能点燃稀的混合气。

name: grim
interpret: adj.严酷的，令人害怕的，不愉快的，讨厌的
example: 单词 grim 的例句||||I've had a grim day. 我过了不愉快的一天。||||His expression was grim when he told them they had lost their jobs. 当他告诉他们说他们已被解雇时，他的表情十分冷酷。

name: haul
interpret: vt./n.（用力）拖，拉，（用车等）拖运，运送
example: 单词 haul 的例句||||It was a long haul home and we arrived exhausted. 搬运回家的这段路程特别长，到家时我们已筋疲力尽。|||| The rope stood up under the strain of the haul. 这绳子经受不住紧拉。

name: grease
interpret: n.动物脂，油脂，润滑脂；v.抹油，润滑
example: 单词 grease 的例句||||He puts grease on his hair to make it shiny. 他往头发上擦油，使之发亮。||||You have a grease spot on your shirt. 你的衬衣上有块油斑。

name: graze
interpret: v.(牲畜)吃草；放牧；擦过(牲畜)；n.擦伤
example: 单词 graze 的例句||||There is good grassland here for your cattle and horses to graze on. 这里有很好的草地供你们放牧牛马。||||Nothing serious. Just a graze. 没关系，就破了一点皮。

name: flap
interpret: n.垂下物，帽沿，袋盖；v.拍打，拍动
example: 单词 flap 的例句||||Although I moistened it, the flap doesn't stick to the envelope. 我把信封弄湿了，可是信封口盖还是粘不上。||||With a flap of its wings the sparrow flew off. 麻雀忒儿一声飞了。

name: flank
interpret: n.肋，（动物的）侧边，侧翼；vt.位于...的侧面
example: 单词 flank 的例句||||We were taken in flank by a troop of cavalry. 我们翼侧受到一队骑兵的袭击。||||They continued along the flank of the mountain. 他们沿着山的一侧继续前行。

name: linear
interpret: adj.线的，直线的，线状的，长度的，线性的
example: 单词 linear 的例句||||He's making linear measurements. 他正在进行长度测量。|||| Here are linear measures in millimeters. 这是毫米方式的线性量度。

name: masculine
interpret: adj.男性的，男子的，男子气的
example: 单词 masculine 的例句||||She has a rather masculine voice. 她的声音有点男性化。|||| The ceremony is exclusively masculine. 典礼上清一色的全是男人。

name: negligible
interpret: adj. 可以忽略的，微不足道的
example: 单词 negligible 的例句||||There is a negligible difference in meaning between these two words. 这两个词之间在意义上差别是极小的。|||| He is a negligible person in the government. 在政府中他是个微不足道的人。

name: likelihood
interpret: n.可能，可能性
example: 单词 likelihood 的例句||||We must try our best to reduce the likelihood of war. 我们必须尽最大努力减少战争的可能性。|||| I don't think there is any likelihood of his agreeing to it. 我认为不会有他同意那件事情的可能。

name: marginal
interpret: adj.微小的，仅以微弱多数获胜的，有旁注的
example: 单词 marginal 的例句||||He won the most marginal seat by only two votes. 他只以两票的微弱优势当选。|||| This once important social group is becoming more and more marginal. 这个一度十分重要的社会集团越来越无足轻重了。

name: liable
interpret: adj.有...倾向的，有法律责任的
example: 单词 liable 的例句||||We are all liable to make mistakes when we're tired. 我们疲劳的时候都容易出错。|||| He is liable for the fault of his son. 他应该为他儿子的过失负责。

name: liability
interpret: n.责任[pl.]负债，债务，不利条件
example: 单词 liability 的例句||||Bad pronunciation is a liability in being a narrator. 不良的发音是做解说员的不利条件。|||| Because of his injury, Tom was just a liability to the team. 汤姆的伤使他成为全队的累赘。

name: manuscript
interpret: n.手稿，原稿，底稿，手写本
example: 单词 manuscript 的例句||||The adaptation of the play for radio manuscript was easy. 把剧本改编成广播稿很容易。|||| The lost manuscript was found in a repository in France. 丢失的手稿在法国的一个存放处被找到了。

name: lever
interpret: n.杠（杆），途径，工具，手段；vt.撬动（起）
example: 单词 lever 的例句||||He is repairing the brake lever of an automobile. 他正在修理汽车的刹车杆。||||Pity is a lever for quickening love. 怜悯是加速爱情的手段。

name: manipulate
interpret: vt.操纵，控制，影响，（熟练地）使用
example: 单词 manipulate 的例句||||Primitive man quickly learned how to manipulate tools. 原始人很快就学会了使用工具。||||Do you know how to manipulate a computer? 你知道如何使用计算机吗？

name: manifest
interpret: n.载货单，运货单，旅客名单；adj.显然的，明白的；vt.显示，证实，出示
example: 单词 manifest 的例句||||It was their manifest failure to modernize the country's industries. 他们使国家进行工业现代化，明显失败了。||||That is manifest to all of us. 那对我们大家来说是显而易见的。

name: induce
interpret: vt.引诱，劝；引起，导致
example: 单词 induce 的例句||||The medicine will induce sleep. 这种药使人入睡。|||| Certain chemicals can induce undesirable changes in the nervous system. 有些化学物质能在神经系统中引起不良变化。

name: legislation
interpret: n.立法，法律的制定；法规，法律
example: 单词 legislation 的例句||||They began to draft legislation. 他们开始起草法规。||||The liberals band together against the new legislation. 自由党员联合一致反对新的立法。

name: indispensable
interpret: adj.必不可少的，绝对必要的
example: 单词 indispensable 的例句||||He is indispensable to our work, we cannot do it without him. 对于我们的工作来说，他是不可缺少的，没有他我们就做不了。||||This is an indispensable part of his creed. 这是他的信条中必不可少的一部分。

name: indignation
interpret: n.愤怒，愤慨，义愤
example: 单词 indignation 的例句||||The news aroused the great indignation. 这消息激起了极大的愤慨。||||It caused some protest and indignation. 这引起了一些抗议和愤慨。

name: indicative
interpret: adj.(of)象征的；陈述的；n.陈述语气
example: 单词 indicative 的例句||||His presence is indicative of his willingness to help. 他的出席表示他愿意帮忙。||||Use the indicative mood to make a sentence. 请用陈述语气造句。

name: incorporate
interpret: vt.包含，加上，吸收；把…合并，使并入
example: 单词 incorporate 的例句||||Paints incorporate with oil. 颜料与油混合在一起。||||We had to incorporate the company for tax reasons. 由于纳税的原因，我们不得不把那家公司合并了。

name: magnitude
interpret: n.大小；重大；星等
example: 单词 magnitude 的例句||||I want to know the magnitude of this equipment. 我想知道这个设备的大小。||||I hadn't realized the magnitude of the problem. 我没有认识到这个问题的重要性。

name: magnify
interpret: vt.放大，扩大；夸大，夸张
example: 单词 magnify 的例句||||He tried to magnify the part he played in the battle. 他试图夸大他在战斗中发挥的作用。||||Tony wanted to magnify that picture. 托尼要把那张照片放大。

name: inclusive
interpret: adj.(of)包括的，包含的；范围广的
example: 单词 inclusive 的例句||||The bill is inclusive of the food and lodging. 账单包括吃、住费用。||||It's an all inclusive price. There is nothing extra to pay. 这是一个包罗一切的价格，不需再额外付款了。

name: periodical
interpret: n.期刊；adj.定期的，时而发生的
example: 单词 periodical 的例句||||They have already put out a new periodical. 他们已经出版了一种新的期刊。||||I expect regular periodical reports from you. 我希望你定期向我汇报。

name: reciprocal
interpret: adj.相互的，互惠的，互补的；n.相互，互惠 [数］ 倒数
example: 单词 reciprocal 的例句||||Our relationship is based on reciprocal respect. 我们的关系是以互相尊重为基础的。||||Although I gave him many presents, I had no reciprocal gifts from him. 虽然我给他很多礼物，但我没有收到过他给我的礼物。

name: periodic
interpret: adj.周期的，定期的，时而发生的
example: 单词 periodic 的例句||||Long long ago, we knew the periodic motion of a planet. 很久以前，我们就知道行星的周期运动。||||These arrangements are subject to periodic reviews. 这几项安排每隔一定时间须予复查。

name: perfection
interpret: n.尽善尽美，无比精确
example: 单词 perfection 的例句||||Their works reach to a great height of perfection. 他们的作品到了极完美的境地。||||The picture wants something of perfection. 这幅画还有些不够完美。

name: rational
interpret: adj.合理的，理性的，能推理的；n.有理数
example: 单词 rational 的例句||||It was a rational plan and bound to succeed. 这是一个合理的计划，肯定会成功。||||The reasoning seems rational. 这论据似乎是合乎情理的。

name: rash
interpret: adj.轻率的；n.（皮）疹，爆发的一连串
example: 单词 rash 的例句||||My skin has broken out in an itchy rash. 我的皮肤上突然长出一片让人发痒的皮疹。||||Don't be rash in making your decision. 别轻率做出决定。

name: ventilate
interpret: vt.使通风，把...公开，公开讨论
example: 单词 ventilate 的例句||||We ventilate a room by opening windows. 我们开窗以使室内空气流通。||||The lungs ventilate the blood. 肺吸收新鲜空气使血液静化。

name: threshold
interpret: n.界限，门槛，入口，开端
example: 单词 threshold 的例句||||I'll never cross the threshold of your house again. 我再也不进你的家门了。||||He stopped at the threshold of the bedroom. 他在卧室门口停住了。

name: sermon
interpret: n.布道，讲道，说教，冗长的讲话
example: 单词 sermon 的例句||||The minister preaches a sermon now and then. 牧师不时地讲道。||||Don't preach me a sermon, please. 请不要对我讲大道理。

name: sentiment
interpret: n.感情，情趣，意见，观点，多愁善感
example: 单词 sentiment 的例句||||He has illustrated this sentiment thoroughly in a drama. 他在一出戏剧里充分地表现了这种感情。||||Should sentiment be controlled by reason? 感情应受理智的控制吗？

name: patron
interpret: n.资助人，赞助人，老主顾，顾客
example: 单词 patron 的例句||||The student wants to find a wealthy patron in America. 那学生想在美国找一个富有的赞助人。||||I hope that you will become our patron. 我希望你将成为我们的靠山。

name: orient
interpret: adj.[诗]东方的，闪闪发光的；n.东方，珍珠，东方国家；vt.使向东，确定方向，定位，以...为参照，使熟悉或适应；vi.转向东方
example: 单词 orient 的例句||||The people in the Orient are mainly yellow or brown. 东方国家的人种主要是黄色的或棕色的。||||We must orient our work to the needs of the people. 我们必须使我们的工作面向人民的需要。

name: pathetic
interpret: adj.悲哀的，可怜的，感伤的，不足的，差强人意的
example: 单词 pathetic 的例句||||The animal gave a pathetic little whimper. 这只动物低声哀叫，令人怜悯。||||I refused to go along with their pathetic charade. 我拒不跟他们摆出那副可悲的装模作样的姿态。

name: radiant
interpret: adj.容光焕发的，光芒四射的，辐射的
example: 单词 radiant 的例句||||He gave a radiant smile when he heard the news. 他听到这个消息后露出欣喜的微笑。||||She was radiant with joy. 她高兴得容光焕发。

name: pasture
interpret: n.牧场，牲畜饲养
example: 单词 pasture 的例句||||This is the place where they used to pasture. 这就是他们过去经常放牧的地方。||||The boy got up very early every morning to pasture cattle. 这男孩每天起得很早去放牛。

name: optimum
interpret: adj.最合适的，最优的，最佳的
example: 单词 optimum 的例句||||Do you know the optimum temperature for the growth of plants? 你知道庄稼生长的最佳温度吗？ ||||Now your advice is very optimum. 现在你的建议是很适宜的。

name: optical
interpret: adj.光（学）的，眼的，视力的，视觉的
example: 单词 optical 的例句||||He has optical trouble. 他的视力有问题。||||Telescopes and microscopes are optical instruments. 望远镜和显微镜是光学仪器。

name: partition
interpret: n.分开，隔板，隔开；vt.分割，隔开
example: 单词 partition 的例句||||She tapped on the glass partition and the car stopped. 她轻轻敲击玻璃隔板，汽车便停了下来。||||There is a plywood partition between the two rooms. 两个房子中间有一个夹板墙。

name: paralyse
interpret: vt.使麻痹，使瘫痪，使不能正常活动，[电]关闭
example: 单词 paralyse 的例句||||Software invalidation has become the main cause of the system paralyse. 软件失效已成为系统瘫痪的主要原因。||||The stroke left him paralyse on one side of his body. 他因患中风而致半身不遂。

name: quest
interpret: n.寻求，搜索，追求
example: 单词 quest 的例句||||Man will suffer many disappointments in his quest for truth. 人类在探索真理过程中必然会遭受挫折。|||| His quest for perfection is relentless. 他不断追求完美。

name: validity
interpret: n.有效性，正确性，正当
example: 单词 validity 的例句||||I would question the validity of that assumption. 我会质疑那个假设的正当性。||||The tests have been shown to be of dubious validity. 这些试验的有效性已显得令人怀疑。

name: uphold
interpret: vt.举起，支撑，赞成
example: 单词 uphold 的例句||||We will loyally uphold the principles of the United Nations. 我们将忠实地维护联合国的原则。|||| It's up to the government to uphold the rights of individual citizens. 政府有责任维护各个公民的权利。

name: thesis
interpret: n.论题，论点，论文
example: 单词 thesis 的例句||||His thesis is being finished off. 他的论文快写完了。||||He argued his thesis well. 他为他的论点进行了有力的辩论。

name: sensation
interpret: n.感觉，感知力，激动，轰动
example: 单词 sensation 的例句||||He lost all sensation in his legs through cramp. 他的腿部因抽筋而失去知觉。||||Seeing him again after so many years was a strange sensation. 那么多年以后又见到他，是一种不可思议的感觉。

name: segment
interpret: n.切片，部分，段，节
example: 单词 segment 的例句||||The company dominates this segment of the market. 这家公司控制着这一部分市场。||||Give me a segment of a tangerine to taste. 给我一瓣柑橘尝一尝。

name: underestimate
interpret: vt.对...估价过低，低估
example: 单词 underestimate 的例句||||Don't underestimate the role of theory. 不要轻视理论的作用。||||I think a lot of people still underestimate him. 我觉得很多人仍然低估了他。

name: unanimous
interpret: adj.全体一致的，一致同意的
example: 单词 unanimous 的例句||||In the end, the decision to scrap the project was unanimous. 最后，大家一致决定放弃这一项目。||||The country is unanimous in its support of the government's policy. 全国一致支持政府的政策。

name: ultraviolet
interpret: adj.紫外线的；n.紫外线
example: 单词 ultraviolet 的例句||||It's called ultraviolet rays. 它被叫做紫外线。||||The sun's ultraviolet rays are responsible for both tanning and burning. 阳光中的紫外线是皮肤晒黑和灼伤的根源。

name: testify
interpret: vt. 证明，证实；作证 vi. 作证；证明
example: 单词 testify 的例句||||The fingerprint expert was asked to testify at the trial. 指纹专家应邀出庭作证。||||I can testify to this man's veracity and good character. 我可以作证，此人诚实可靠，品德良好。

name: seam
interpret: n.缝，接缝；vt.用缝缝，接缝；vi.有裂缝
example: 单词 seam 的例句||||The seam of his coat is pulled. 他外套的线缝被撕开了。||||His shirt ripped at the seam. 他的衬衣缝口撕开了。

name: terrace
interpret: n.平台，阳台，梯田；vt.使成梯田，给...建阳台
example: 单词 terrace 的例句||||The dining-room opens onto a paved terrace. 餐厅通往一个铺砌的露台。||||She was waiting for him at the cafe terrace. 她在咖啡馆露台上等他。

name: terminate
interpret: adj.有结尾的，有限的；vt.结束，终止，满期；vi.达到终点
example: 单词 terminate 的例句||||You have no right to terminate the contract. 你无权终止合同。||||Many adverbs terminate in -ly. 许多副词以“ly”结尾。

name: regime
interpret: n.政体，政权，制度
example: 单词 regime 的例句||||Under the new regime in our office, no one is allowed to leave early. 在新的办公制度下，谁也不能早退。||||The people finally rose up and overthrew the reactionary regime. 人们终于起来把反动的政权推翻了。

name: refrain
interpret: n.重复，叠句，副歌；v.节制，避免，克制
example: 单词 refrain 的例句||||I made a terrific effort to refrain from tears. 我狠着心把泪止住。||||They all sang the refrain. 他们齐声合唱叠句。

name: scandal
interpret: n.丑事，丑闻，流言蜚语，反感，愤慨
example: 单词 scandal 的例句||||Scandal and gossip are meat and drink to him. 各种丑闻和流言蜚语是他最感兴趣的事。||||His theft from the shop caused scandal in the village. 他因偷商店的东西引起全村的公愤。

name: tactics
interpret: n.策略；战术，兵法
example: 单词 tactics 的例句||||They planned the tactics for the next day's battle. 他们制定好第二天的战术。||||He decided to switch tactics. 他决定改变策略。

name: reed
interpret: n.芦苇，芦丛，簧舌，簧片
example: 单词 reed 的例句||||The river banks were overgrown with reed. 河岸长满了芦苇。||||They inhabit reed huts built on stilts above the water. 他们住在建于水中木桩之上的芦苇草屋里。

name: tackle
interpret: n.工具，复滑车，扭倒；v.处理，抓住
example: 单词 tackle 的例句||||Don't forget to bring your sports tackle with you tomorrow. 别忘了明天带上你的体育用具。||||We have gained sufficient experience to tackle this problem. 我们已经有了足够的经验来处理这个问题。

name: reconcile
interpret: vt.使协调，使和解，使顺从（甘心）（于）
example: 单词 reconcile 的例句||||Must they reconcile themselves to their fate? 难道他们甘心忍受这种命运吗？||||He found it hard to reconcile himself to the disagreeable state. 他发现难以忍受这种不愉快的状况。

name: reckless
interpret: adj.粗心大意的，鲁莽的
example: 单词 reckless 的例句||||The policeman chewed out the driver for reckless driving. 那位司机因为开车莽撞，被警察狠狠批评了一顿。||||He thought she was too reckless at it. 他觉得她对它太粗心大意了。

name: degrade
interpret: vt.降级，贬低，堕落，退化
example: 单词 degrade 的例句||||A dishonest action like that will degrade you. 像这样不诚实的行为会使你降低身份。||||You degrade yourself when you tell a lie. 说谎会贬低自己的身分。

name: defy
interpret: vt.（公然）藐视，使成为不可能，挑，激
example: 单词 defy 的例句||||If you defy the law, you may find yourself in prison. 如果你不服从法律，你就可能会坐牢。|||| Criminals defy the law. 罪犯无视法律。

name: blaze
interpret: n.火焰，火堆，火光，火灾；vi.燃烧，着火
example: 单词 blaze 的例句||||In a blaze of anger he shouted at them. 他怒火中烧，对着他们大吼起来。||||Dry wood makes a good blaze. 干木燃起夺目的光焰。

name: default
interpret: n./v.拖欠，违约，欠缺，默认，缺省
example: 单词 default 的例句||||He lost the world title by default. 他由于弃权而失去了世界冠军的称号。||||In default of experts' help, we shall have to rely on our own efforts. 没有专家的帮助，我们将只得依靠自己的力量。

name: deem
interpret: vt.认为，相信；vi.想
example: 单词 deem 的例句||||We deem it necessavy to make this clear to you. 这件事我们认为有必要跟你们说清楚。||||I deem it my duty to help the poor. 我认为帮助穷人是我的职责。

name: cavity
interpret: n.洞，穴，凹处，龋洞
example: 单词 cavity 的例句||||There's a cavity in the boy's tooth. 这个男孩的牙上有一个洞。||||The dentist carefully located the filling in the cavity. 牙医小心地把填塞的东西放入牙洞里。

name: decree
interpret: n.法令，政令，判决，裁决；vt.判决，命令
example: 单词 decree 的例句||||The court granted her a decree of divorce. 法院判决她离婚。||||They had to obey the decree that beards be shaved off. 他们只得服从剃光胡须的法令。

name: beforehand
interpret: adj.事先，预先，提前地，超前地
example: 单词 beforehand 的例句||||If I'd known this beforehand, I would not have gone back. 早知如此，我就不回去了。|||| They proposed to make arrangement beforehand. 他们提议事先做好安排。

name: decisive
interpret: adj.决定性的，坚定的，果断的，决断的
example: 单词 decisive 的例句||||A decisive person acts quickly and often succeeds. 果断的人行动迅速，常常成功。||||Man is a decisive factor in doing everything. 人是做每件事情的决定性因素。

name: bearing
interpret: n.关系，影响，举止，姿态，方位，方向
example: 单词 bearing 的例句||||What you said had not much bearing on the problem. 你说的话跟这个问题没有多大关系。||||He preserved his grave and dignified bearing. 他保持庄重威严的仪态。

name: captive
interpret: adj.被俘虏的，不得自由行动的，被监禁的
example: 单词 captive 的例句||||They led him captive. 他们将他活捉。||||The rock star had a captive audience. 那位摇滚歌星倾倒了许多观众。

name: bandit
interpret: n.土匪，盗匪，歹徒
example: 单词 bandit 的例句||||The police frustrated the bandit's attempt to rob the bank. 警方挫败了匪徒抢劫银行的企图。||||Her eyes were walled up by the bandit. 她的眼睛被那个匪徒蒙住了。

name: baffle
interpret: vt.使挫折；n.迷惑
example: 单词 baffle 的例句||||He tried hard to baffle our plan. 他力图阻挠我们的计划。||||One of the exam question baffle me completely. 有道考题完全把我难倒了。

name: ally
interpret: n.同盟者，同盟国；vt.使结盟，与...有关联
example: 单词 ally 的例句||||In that war England was not an ally, she was neutral. 在那场战争中，英国不同任何一国结盟，保持中立。||||She felt she needed an ally so badly. 她感到她极需一个支持者。

name: affirm
interpret: vt.断言，坚持声称，证实，确认
example: 单词 affirm 的例句||||We can not affirm that what should be done the next step. 我们不能肯定下一步该做什么。||||I dare not affirm whether we can use so this word. 我不敢肯定我们是否能这样用这个词。

name: adjoin
interpret: vt.贴近，毗连，靠近
example: 单词 adjoin 的例句||||The two houses adjoin. 这两座房子邻接。||||It is forbidden to adjoin to a postcard any sample of merchandise. 在明信片上附贴商品的样品是不许可的。

name: adhere
interpret: vi.粘附，附着，遵守，坚持，追随，支持
example: 单词 adhere 的例句||||Most people adhere to the church of their parents. 多数人都依附于父母的教会。||||They failed to adhere to our original agreement. 他们未能遵守我们原定的协议。

name: acquaint
interpret: vt.（with）使认识，使了解，使熟悉
example: 单词 acquaint 的例句||||You must acquaint yourself with your new duties. 你必须熟悉你的新任务。||||Let me acquaint you with the facts. 让我把事实告诉你。

name: accord
interpret: vt.给予（欢迎、称颂等） vi./n.符合，一致
example: 单词 accord 的例句||||Most people are in accord with their desire for peace. 在渴望和平这一点上，大多数人都是一致的。||||The hearts of our people accord with those of yours. 我们两国人民心心相印。

name: abundance
interpret: n.大量，丰富，充足
example: 单词 abundance 的例句||||At the feast there was food and drink in abundance. 宴会上有丰富的饮食。||||There is an abundance of commodity supplies on the markets. 商品供应充足。

name: coincide
interpret: vi.同时发生，相符，位置重合，重叠
example: 单词 coincide 的例句||||His tastes and habits coincide with those of his wife. 他的爱好跟习惯恰好和他的妻子相同。||||He happened to coincide with you on this point. 在这一问题上，他与你不谋而合。

name: bypass
interpret: n.旁道；分流术；vt.绕过，越过...于不顾
example: 单词 bypass 的例句||||If we take the bypass we'll avoid the town centre. 我们走旁道就能绕过镇中心。||||You cannot bypass this question. 你不能回避这个问题。

name: commend
interpret: vt. 推荐；称赞；把…委托 vi. 称赞；表扬
example: 单词 commend 的例句||||We should commend good people and good deeds. 我们应当表扬好人好事。||||His ideas do not commend themselves to me. 他的看法没给我留下好的印象。

name: commodity
interpret: n.日用品，商品，物品
example: 单词 commodity 的例句||||The authorities took measures to roll commodity price back. 当局采取措施使物价全面回降。||||Commodity prices remain stable and there are plenty of goods on the market. 商品价格稳定，市场货源充足。

name: commonplace
interpret: adj.平凡的，普通的；n.寻常的事物，常见的事
example: 单词 commonplace 的例句||||Soon it will be commonplace for men to travel to the moon. 人们去月球旅行很快就会成为常事。||||What he has said is a mere commonplace view. 他所说的不过是尘俗之见而已。

name: complication
interpret: n.（新出现的）困难，难题，并发症
example: 单词 complication 的例句||||This was an unforeseen complication. 这是未预见到的复杂情况。||||The car ran out of petrol, and as a further complication I had no money? 汽车没油了，更麻烦的是我身上没有钱？

name: compatible
interpret: adj.兼容的；能和睦相处的，合得来的
example: 单词 compatible 的例句||||You should choose a roommate more compatible to your tastes. 你应该挑个和你意气更相投的人同住一室。||||Health and hard work are compatible. 健康与努力工作是一致的。

name: comply
interpret: vi.遵照，照做，应允，顺从，服从
example: 单词 comply 的例句||||She was told to pay the fine, but refused to comply. 她被通知交纳罚款，但她拒不服从。|||| Candidates must comply strictly with these instructions. 候选人必须严格遵守这些指示。

name: conviction
interpret: n.确信，坚定的信仰；说服，信服；定罪
example: 单词 conviction 的例句||||His conviction carried him along in his research. 他的信心支持着他把研究工作坚持下去。||||His conviction caused rioting in the streets. 他被判有罪，引起了街头骚动。

name: cooperative
interpret: adj.有合作意向的，合作的；n.合作社（企业）等
example: 单词 cooperative 的例句||||The workmen are very cooperative, so the work goes on smoothly. 工人们十分合作，所以工作进展顺利。||||We decided to set up a cooperative. 我们决定开办一家合作社。

name: composite
interpret: adj.混合成的，综合成的；n.合成物，复合材料
example: 单词 composite 的例句||||English is a composite of many languages. 英语是多种语言混合而成的。||||This composite illustration was made by putting together a number of drawings. 这本综合说明书是集若干图片汇合而成的。

name: correlate
interpret: n.相互关联的事物；v.（with，to）（使）互相关联
example: 单词 correlate 的例句||||These figures seem to correlate. 这些数字看来是相关的。||||Research workers find it hard to correlate the two sets of figures. 研究人员发现很难使这两组数字互相关连。

name: destiny
interpret: n.命运，定数，天命
example: 单词 destiny 的例句||||Nobody knows his own destiny. 没有人知道自己的命运。||||It was her destiny to become famous. 她命里注定出名。

name: destructive
interpret: adj.破坏（性）的，毁灭（性）的
example: 单词 destructive 的例句||||In the end, it will be destructive of our whole society. 它最终会毁灭我们整个社会。||||It is the most destructive storm in 20 years. 这是20年来破坏性最大的一次风暴。

name: conceive
interpret: vt.设想，构想，怀孕，受（孕）
example: 单词 conceive 的例句||||You may conceive a new world in the atomic age. 你可以设想出原子时代的新世界。||||I can hardly conceive of your doing such a thing. 我很难想象你会做出这种事情。

name: detain
interpret: vt.拘留，扣留，留住，耽搁
example: 单词 detain 的例句||||The act allows police to detain a suspect for up to 48 hours. 该法令允许警方将嫌疑犯扣押最多48小时。||||Allow me to detain you for a moment. 请允许我耽误你一会。

name: cosmic
interpret: adj.宇宙的，广大无边的
example: 单词 cosmic 的例句||||That is a cosmic law that must be respected. 这是宇宙的法则必须遵守。||||This has all the appearance of a cosmic free lunch. 这就产生了广泛的免费午餐。

name: counsel
interpret: n.忠告，劝告，律师，法律顾问；vt.劝告
example: 单词 counsel 的例句||||The judge asked counsel for the defence to explain. 法官要求被告的辩护律师做出解释。||||He refused to listen to the old man's counsel. 他拒不听从老人的忠告。

name: conform
interpret: vi.（to）遵守，适应，相似，一致，符合
example: 单词 conform 的例句||||The building does not conform to safety regulations. 这座建筑物不符合安全条例。||||Her ideas do not conform with mine. 她的观点与我的不一致。

name: courtesy
interpret: n.谦恭有礼，礼貌的举止，好意，恩惠
example: 单词 courtesy 的例句||||She called on us merely for the sake of courtesy. 她来访只是为了礼貌。||||After a few words of courtesy, they got down to business. 双方客气了一番，就开始谈正事。

name: doubtless
interpret: adv.无疑地，肯定地
example: 单词 doubtless 的例句||||It will doubtless rain on the day of the garden party. 游园会那天很可能会下雨。||||She is doubtless my best friend. 她无疑是我最好的朋友。

name: drainage
interpret: n.排水系统，下水道，排水，放水
example: 单词 drainage 的例句||||This is a drainage area. 这里是排水区。||||Bad drainage caused the land to be flooded. 排水不利容易使土地淹水。

name: eternal
interpret: adj.永久的，无休止的，永恒的，永不改变的
example: 单词 eternal 的例句||||Stop this eternal chatter? 不要唠叨个不停？ ||||Rome has been called the Eternal City. 罗马一向被称为不朽之城。

name: drastic
interpret: adj.严厉的，极端的，激烈的，猛烈的
example: 单词 drastic 的例句||||His view brings a drastic argument. 他的观点引起激烈的争论。||||The situation brings home to us the need for drastic preventive actions. 这种情况使我们深切地感到采取极端的行动是必要的。

name: fluctuate
interpret: vi.波动，起伏，动摇；vt.使波动，使起伏
example: 单词 fluctuate 的例句||||Prices fluctuate from year to year. 物价年年波动。||||Body temperature can fluctuate if you are ill. 人患病后体温可能会上下波动。

name: duplicate
interpret: n.复制品；v.复写，使加倍；adj.复制的，二倍的
example: 单词 duplicate 的例句||||The manager asks the secretary to duplicate the document. 经理让秘书复印这份文件。||||This agreement is done in duplicate. 本协议书一式两份。

name: excel
interpret: v.胜过，优于，杰出，善于，擅长于
example: 单词 excel 的例句||||If your talent combines with diligence, you can excel in your pursuit. 如果你把天赋与勤奋结合起来，你所追求的事业便会出类拔萃。||||He is working hard to excel his predecessors. 他正努力超越他的前任。

name: fury
interpret: n.狂怒，激烈，狂怒的人，（希神）复仇女神
example: 单词 fury 的例句||||She felt a wave of wild fury overcame her. 她顿时觉得怒不可遏。||||He flew into fury when I said I couldn't help him. 当我说不能帮助他时，他立刻暴跳如雷。

name: fuse
interpret: n.导火线，引信，保险丝；v.熔，烧断电路
example: 单词 fuse 的例句||||The metal will fuse at a relatively low temperature. 这金属在不太高的温度下熔化。||||This is the right fuse for the refrigerator. 这是电冰箱上使用的保险丝。

name: exemplify
interpret: vt.是（作为）典型（或榜样），举例证明
example: 单词 exemplify 的例句||||He exemplify the new liberalism. 他反映了新自由主义的观点。||||I'm going to exemplify one or two of these points. 我打算就论点中的一、两个方面举例说明。

name: forge
interpret: v.使形成，与...建立密切联系，伪造，假冒
example: 单词 forge 的例句||||Everything new comes from the forge of hard and bitter struggle. 一切新东西都是从艰苦斗争中锻炼出来的。||||Difficulties help to forge people into able folk. 困难有助于把人们锻炼成能干的人。

name: exile
interpret: n.流放，被流放者；vt.流放，放逐，使流亡
example: 单词 exile 的例句||||After an exile of eight years her uncle returned to Cairo. 她叔叔背井离乡8年后返回开罗。|||| Napoleon was sent into exile on an island. 拿破仑被流放到一个岛上。

name: formidable
interpret: a.可怕的；难以克服的，难对付的
example: 单词 formidable 的例句||||He met with a woman with a formidable appearance. 他遇到了一个样子可怕的女人。|||| There's no formidable obstacles in the world. 世上没有无法逾越的障碍。

name: expel
interpret: vt.把...开除，驱逐，放逐，排出，喷出
example: 单词 expel 的例句||||They were told at first that they should simply expel the refugees. 一开始有人告诉他们应该直接将那些难民驱逐出境。||||The headmaster may expel the boy from the school. 校长可能要把那个男孩从学校开除。

name: fort
interpret: n.要塞，堡垒，碉堡
example: 单词 fort 的例句||||The fort can not be defended against an air attack. 这座要塞遭到空袭时无法防御。||||No one can get into the fort without a pass. 没有通行证，任何人不得进入要塞。

name: forthcoming
interpret: adj.即将到来的，可得到的，乐于提供消息的
example: 单词 forthcoming 的例句||||He gave me a list of their forthcoming books. 他给了我一张他们即将出版图书的目录。||||Her letter may purport her forthcoming arrival. 她的来信可能意味着她快要到了。

name: expire
interpret: vi.期满，（期限）终止，断气，死亡
example: 单词 expire 的例句||||His term of office as president will expire next year. 他的总统任期明年将届满。||||When does your trade agreement with Japan expire? 你们同日本签订的贸易协定何时期满？

name: grope
interpret: vi.暗中摸，摸索，探索，搜寻；vt.摸索
example: 单词 grope 的例句||||I grope for the light switch in the dark room. 我在黑洞洞的屋里摸索着寻找电灯开关。||||We have to grope for ways to do thing. 我们只能边摸索边干。

name: gross
interpret: adj.全部的，粗俗的，肥胖的；vt.获得...总收入
example: 单词 gross 的例句||||The gross weight of the box of chocolates is 500 grams. 那盒巧克力的全部重量是500克。||||I consider this a gross oversight on your part. 我把这件事看作是你的一大疏忽。

name: freight
interpret: n.货物，货运；vt.运送（货物）看，装货于
example: 单词 freight 的例句||||Tons of freight were flown into this airport every day. 每天有许多吨货物被空运到这个机场。|||| There is ten yuan in the bill for freight. 发票中包括运费十元。

name: tyranny
interpret: n.暴虐，残暴，专横，暴政，专制
example: 单词 tyranny 的例句||||They came to America in order to escape political tyranny. 他们为逃避暴政而来到美洲。||||They lived underneath a crushing tyranny. 他们生活在难以忍受的暴政下。

name: perish
interpret: vi.丧生，毁灭，消亡，失去弹性，老化
example: 单词 perish 的例句||||Crowns and thrones may perish. 王权不会永存。|||| Steam will fill the atmosphere and all life will perish. 水蒸汽将充满大气层，所有的生命都将毁灭。

name: lubricate
interpret: vt.使润滑；vi.加润滑油
example: 单词 lubricate 的例句||||Mineral oils are used to lubricate machinery. 矿物油被用来润滑机器。||||You should lubricate the wheels of your bicycle once a month. 你应该每个月给自行车轮子加一次润滑油。

name: homogeneous
interpret: adj.同种类的，同性质的，有相同特征的
example: 单词 homogeneous 的例句||||They are homogeneous people. 他们是同类人。||||Russia is ethnically relatively homogeneous. 俄罗斯是个民族成分相对单一的国家。

name: extinguish
interpret: vt.压制，压抑，熄灭，扑灭（火）等
example: 单词 extinguish 的例句||||You may extinguish a nation, but not the love of liberty. 你可以消灭一个国家，但不能消灭对自由的热爱。||||It took about 50 minutes to extinguish the fire. 大约花了50分钟才把火扑灭。

name: compensation
interpret: n.补偿（或赔偿）的款物，补偿，赔偿
example: 单词 compensation 的例句||||Workers who have been unfairly dismissed may claim compensation. 被无理开除的工人可以要求补偿。||||Equal compensation should be given to men and women for equal work. 男女同工应同酬。

name: cite
interpret: vt.引用，引证，举例
example: 单词 cite 的例句||||It would be an endless task to cite such living examples. 这样的实例举不胜举。||||I'll just cite some figures for comparison. 我要引用一些数字作比较。

name: analogy
interpret: n.类似，相似，类比，类推
