example: 单词 analogy 的例句||||It is not always reliable to argue by analogy. 靠类推法论证并不总是可靠的。||||A close analogy with the art of singing can be made. 可以用歌唱艺术作类比。

name: safeguard
interpret: vt.保护，维护；n.预防措施，保证条款
example: 单词 safeguard 的例句||||Keeping clean is a safeguard against disease. 保持清洁是抵御疾病的防护措施。||||We must safeguard forest timber. 我们必须保护森林。

name: fabricate
interpret: vt.捏造，编造（谎言、借口等），建造，制造
example: 单词 fabricate 的例句||||They plan to fabricate a cinema next year. 他们计划明年建造一座电影院。||||It angers me that people would fabricate a story like that. 人们编造这样的谎话让我感到愤怒。

name: damn
interpret: int.该死，他妈的；vt.指责，贬斥，诅咒
example: 单词 damn 的例句||||Damn this useless typewriter? 这台破打字机真该死？||||I knew damn well what he was going to say. 我非常清楚他要说什么。

name: blunder
interpret: n.错误；vi.跌跌撞撞地走，慌乱地走，犯错误
example: 单词 blunder 的例句||||I saw that I had been guilty of a careless blunder. 我意识到自己因疏忽而酿成大错。||||He has made a terrible blunder. 他铸成大错。

name: clamp
interpret: n.夹子，钳子；vt.（用夹钳）夹住，夹紧
example: 单词 clamp 的例句||||Clamp the two pieces of wood together until the glue dries. 用夹钳把两块木板夹紧，等胶水干了再松开。||||He used a clamp to hold the arm on the chair until the glue dried. 他用夹子将扶手夹在椅子上，直到胶水干后再取下。

name: clash
interpret: vi.冲突，不协调，砰地相撞；n.冲突，不协调
example: 单词 clash 的例句||||There is a clash between two classes at 2 p. m. on Thursday. 星期四下午两点有两堂课是冲突的。||||The pot came down on the stone floor with a clash. 锅“当”地一声掉到石地上。

name: clasp
interpret: n.扣子，钩子，握手；v.扣住，钩住，紧握，紧抱
example: 单词 clasp 的例句||||The clasp on his belt had broken. 他的皮带上的钩子已经坏了。||||My button hook won't clasp. 我的钮扣钩怎么也扣不上。

name: brood
interpret: n.同窝幼鸟一个家庭的孩子；v.孵蛋，闷想
example: 单词 brood 的例句||||The hen brought off a brood of young. 母鸡孵出了一窝小鸡。||||It is time for hens to brood. 该是母鸡孵蛋的时候了。

name: clockwise
interpret: adj./adv.顺时针方向的
example: 单词 clockwise 的例句||||Please turn the key in a clockwise direction. 请顺时针转动钥匙。||||Gently swing your right arm in a clockwise direction. 按顺时针方向轻轻摆动右臂。

name: clutch
interpret: n. 离合器；控制；手；紧急关头 vi. 攫；企图抓住 vt. 抓住；紧握
example: 单词 clutch 的例句||||She released the clutch and the car began to move. 她放开离合器，汽车就动了。||||A drowning man will clutch at a straw. 即将溺死的人连一根草也要去抓。

name: bureaucracy
interpret: n.官僚主义，官僚机构，（非民选的）委任官员
example: 单词 bureaucracy 的例句||||The bureaucracy has become ossified. 官僚主义已变得僵化了。||||Bureaucracy may be said as a disease in our very vitals. 官僚主义可说是我们的心腹之患。

name: coherent
interpret: adj.一致的，协调的，（话语）等条理清楚的
example: 单词 coherent 的例句||||These two paragraphs are not coherent enough. 这两段文章不太接气。||||His interpretation is coherent and intelligible. 他的翻译通顺易懂。

name: preside
interpret: vi.（at，over）主持，主管
example: 单词 preside 的例句||||Mr Smith will preside at the next meeting. 史密斯先生将主持下一次会议。||||The minister was asked to preside at the independence ceremonies of the small island state. 那位部长被邀请去主持这个小岛国的独立仪式。

name: pledge
interpret: n.保证，誓言，抵押，抵押品；vt.保证，誓言，举杯祝...健康
example: 单词 pledge 的例句||||Take this ring as a pledge of our friendship. 收下这枚戒指当作我们友谊的信物。||||The old man is willing to pledge for him. 那位老人愿意为他担保。

name: pluck
interpret: v.摘，拔（毛）拨，弹奏，拉；n.勇气，决心
example: 单词 pluck 的例句||||He is full of pluck. 他很有勇气。||||With a few pluck at the string of his banjo, everybody is singing along. 他拨了拨班卓琴的琴弦，每个人就都跟著唱了起了。

name: propaganda
interpret: n.宣传，宣传机构
example: 单词 propaganda 的例句||||A lot of propaganda has painted him as bad. 大量宣传把他说得很坏。||||Art may be used as a vehicle for propaganda. 艺术可以用作为宣传的媒介。

name: propagate
interpret: vt.繁（增）殖，传播，使普及；vi.繁（增）殖
example: 单词 propagate 的例句||||The political party started the newspaper to propagate its ideas. 那个政党创办一份报纸来宣传该党的观点。||||Most plants propagate by seeds. 大多数植物都是通过种子繁殖的。

name: presume
interpret: vt.姑且认定，假定，推测，认为是理所当然；vi.假设，越权行事
example: 单词 presume 的例句||||We mustn't presume too much upon the reliability of such sources. 我们不应过分指望这类消息来源的可靠性。||||You had better presume no such thing. 你最好不要这样设想。

name: prevalent
interpret: adj.流行的，普遍的
example: 单词 prevalent 的例句||||The habit of travelling by aeroplane is becoming more prevalent. 乘飞机旅行的习惯变得越来越盛行了。|||| Colds are prevalent in the winter. 伤风在冬季很普遍。

name: propel
interpret: vt.推进，推动，激励，驱策
example: 单词 propel 的例句||||They use oars to propel boats. 他们用浆推进船只。||||Paddles are used especially to propel canoes and kayaks. 短桨特别用于划独木舟和小艇。

name: prophecy
interpret: n.预言，预言能力
example: 单词 prophecy 的例句||||His prophecy has now come true. 他的预言果然应验了。||||Apollo was the Greek god of the arts, prophecy, medicine and light. 阿波罗是希腊神话中主管艺术、预言、医药和光明之神。

name: prophet
interpret: n.预言家，先知，提倡者
example: 单词 prophet 的例句||||A prophet made a prophecy that the kingdom would fall. 一位预言家预言那个王国将要灭亡。||||The pity is that you are not a prophet. 可惜你不能未卜先知。

name: ponder
interpret: vt.考虑；vi.沉思
example: 单词 ponder 的例句||||You should pause and ponder now. 你现在应该停下来仔细考虑一下。||||He sits to ponder his misfortune there. 他坐在那里沉思着他的不幸。

name: prose
interpret: adj.散文的；n.散文
example: 单词 prose 的例句||||His writings include poetry and prose. 他的作品包括诗和散文。||||He has a taste for purple prose. 他喜欢风格华丽的散文。

name: prototype
interpret: n.原型，典型，范例
example: 单词 prototype 的例句||||This is the prototype for future school buildings. 这是未来的学校建筑的蓝本。||||He was the prototype of the elder statesman. 他是老一辈政治家的典型。

name: provision
interpret: n.供应，预备，条款[pl.]给养，口粮
example: 单词 provision 的例句||||He made no provision against the unforeseen expenses. 他没有准备意外费用。||||It is an express provision. 那是一项明文条款。

name: provoke
interpret: v.激起，引起，对...挑衅，激怒
example: 单词 provoke 的例句||||Don't provoke him to anger. 别招他生气。||||Don't provoke the animal by teasing. It may bite you. 不要挑逗动物，它会咬你的。

name: remainder
interpret: n.余下的部分，剩下的人数
example: 单词 remainder 的例句||||They joined up with us to spend the remainder of the holiday. 他们来跟我们一起共度余下的假期。||||He spent the remainder of his years in Japan. 他在日本度过了余生。

name: rotate
interpret: vi. 旋转；循环 vt. 使旋转；使转动；使轮流
example: 单词 rotate 的例句||||The doctor asked the patient to rotate his eyes. 医生叫病人转动一下眼球。||||You can rotate the wheel with your hand. 你可以用手转动轮子。

name: sharply
interpret: adj.锐利地，急速；adv.严厉地，鲜明地
example: 单词 sharply 的例句||||The plane dived sharply and rose again. 飞机猛然俯冲而后又拉了起来。||||Demand for personal computers has risen sharply. 对个人电脑的需求急剧增长。

name: shatter
interpret: n.碎片，乱七八糟的状态；vt.打碎，破掉，散开；vi.打破，脱落
example: 单词 shatter 的例句||||I must shatter your hopes. 我必须打破你的幻想。|||| This power is strong enough to shatter complacency. 这种力量足以打破自满情绪。

name: ruthless
interpret: adj.无情的，冷酷的，残忍的，坚决彻底的
example: 单词 ruthless 的例句||||Fascists is the most ruthless enemy of the people. 法西斯是人民最残酷无情的敌人。||||The ruthless enemy killed the old lady. 残忍的敌人杀害了那位老太太。

name: resignation
interpret: n.放弃，辞职，反抗
example: 单词 resignation 的例句||||He handed in his resignation right after the cabinet meeting. 内阁会议一开完，他就提出了辞呈。|||| They asked for his resignation with one voice. 他们一致要求他辞职。

name: shorthand
interpret: n.速记，速记法
example: 单词 shorthand 的例句||||The reporters took down the speech in shorthand. 记者们迅速记下讲话的内容。||||Instead of writing her shorthand by hand, she could use a machine. 她可以不用手，而使用一种带键盘的机器进行速记。

name: shove
interpret: vt.乱推，乱塞；vi.用力推，挤；n.猛推
example: 单词 shove 的例句||||She will not shove the heavy load onto others. 她不愿意把重担推给别人。||||Help me shove this furniture aside. 帮我把这家具推到一边去。

name: resultant
interpret: adj.作为结果的，合成的；n.结果，产量，[数学]合矢量，结式
example: 单词 resultant 的例句||||These quantities are called stress resultant. 这些量叫做合应力。||||This single force is called the resultant of the original forces. 这样一个集中力称为原力的合力。

name: retort
interpret: n. 反驳，顶嘴；曲颈瓶 vt. 反驳，反击 vi. 反驳，回嘴
example: 单词 retort 的例句||||I said a few words to him in retort. 我顶了他几句。||||He scored a bull's-eye in their argument with that witty retort. 在他们的辩论中他那一句机智的反驳击中了要害。

name: siege
interpret: n.包围，围攻，围困
example: 单词 siege 的例句||||The city was thrown down during the siege. 在围城过程中，这座城市被摧毁了。||||The enemy lay siege to the town in attempt to starve the people to death. 敌人围城，企图将人们饿死。

name: rigorous
interpret: adj.严密的，缜密的，严格的，严厉的
example: 单词 rigorous 的例句||||The arms trade should be subject to rigorous controls. 对军火贸易应该严加限制。||||The planes have to undergo rigorous safety checks. 飞机必须经过严密的安全检查。

name: sociology
interpret: n.社会学，社会关系学，群落生态学
example: 单词 sociology 的例句||||He is studying sociology. 他正研究社会学。||||A pioneer of legal sociology in Germany was Max Weber. 德国法律社会学的先驱是马克斯·韦伯。

name: riot
interpret: n.暴（骚）乱，（色彩等）极度丰富；vi.聚众闹事
example: 单词 riot 的例句||||They had to call the police in order to put down the riot. 他们只得叫来警察以平定骚乱。||||Flowers of all sorts are blooming in a riot of colour. 百花盛开，万紫千红。

name: simultaneous
interpret: adj.同时发生的，同时存在的，同步的
example: 单词 simultaneous 的例句||||We need a simultaneous interpreter. 我们需要一个同声翻译。||||This event was almost simultaneous with that one. 这件事几乎是与那件事同时发生的。

name: speculate
interpret: v.推测，推断，投机，做投机买卖
example: 单词 speculate 的例句||||It's dangerous to speculate. 做投机买卖是很危险的。||||We don't know all the circumstances, so it would be pointless to speculate. 我们不了解所有的情况，妄加推测是没有意义的。

name: spiral
interpret: adj.螺旋的；n.螺旋（线）；vi.盘旋上升（或下降）
example: 单词 spiral 的例句||||The production in this factory is spiral. 这个厂的产量呈盘旋上升。||||Their profits began to spiral down disastrously. 他们的利润开始螺旋形地急剧下降。

name: spite
interpret: n.（用于短语）虽然，不顾，尽管
example: 单词 spite 的例句||||He has modern ideas in spite of his great age. 尽管他年事很高，但思想观念却很入时。||||In spite of his anger, his remarks were restrained. 他尽管生气，说的话还是有节制的。

name: sovereign
interpret: n.元首，金镑；adj.具有主权的，至高无上的，极好的，完全的
example: 单词 sovereign 的例句||||For a brief time Texas was a sovereign nation. 得克萨斯一度是个主权独立的国家。||||The Queen has sovereign power. 女王握有统治权。

name: stability
interpret: n.稳定，稳固
example: 单词 stability 的例句||||The situation is tending towards stability. 局势趋于稳定。||||She lacks emotional stability. 她的情绪不稳定。

name: stagger
interpret: vi.摇晃着移动，蹒跚；n.摇晃不稳的动作，蹒跚
example: 单词 stagger 的例句||||The unexpected blow did not stagger his resolution. 这个意外打击并没有动摇他的决心。||||We can't hold the two meetings at the same time, we must stagger them. 这两个会不能同时开得错一下。

name: sturdy
interpret: adj.强壮的，结实的，坚固的，坚定(强)的
example: 单词 sturdy 的例句||||We need several sturdy men to push this car. 我们需要几个强壮的人来推车。||||Children need sturdy shoes. 孩子们需要结实的鞋子。

name: substantial
interpret: adj.大的，相当可观的，大体上的
example: 单词 substantial 的例句||||She is preparing a substantial meal against his return. 她正在准备一顿丰盛的饭菜为他接风。||||The country bought a substantial number of weapons. 这个国家购买了大量武器。

name: stern
interpret: adj.严厉的，严格的，严峻的；n.船尾
example: 单词 stern 的例句||||The ship was in a blaze from stem to stern. 整艘船从头到尾都着火了。||||The headmaster ruled the school with a stern discipline. 校长治校严谨。

name: succession
interpret: n.连续，一连串，一系列；v.接替，继任
example: 单词 succession 的例句||||He gave forth a series of works in rapid succession. 他很快连续发表了一系列的作品。||||His succession as headmaster was not in any doubt. 他继任校长是确定无疑的。

name: successor
interpret: n.接替的人或物，继任者
example: 单词 successor 的例句||||He gave over charge of his office to his successor today. 他今天向继任者交接了工作。||||The chairman has designated her as his successor. 主席已指定她作为他的接班人。

name: suffice
interpret: vi.足够，有能力
example: 单词 suffice 的例句||||Some bread and soup will suffice me. 有面包和汤对我来说就足够了。||||Here a single example will suffice. 这里只举一个例子就够了。

name: token
interpret: n.筹码，信物，纪念品，礼券；adj.象征性的
example: 单词 token 的例句||||This little gift is a token of our regard. 这点礼物是我们大家的一点心意。||||Black is a token of mourning. 黑色是沮丧的象征。

name: tolerant
interpret: adj.容忍的，有耐力的
example: 单词 tolerant 的例句||||She's tolerant toward those impudent colleagues. 她对那些无礼的同事采取容忍的态度。||||A tolerant person usually has breadth of mind. 有宽容精神的人通常胸襟开阔。

name: subordinate
interpret: adj.下级的，（to）次要的；n.下级；vt.使从属于
example: 单词 subordinate 的例句||||Those in subordinate positions will follow the example set by their superiors. 上行下效。||||The minority is subordinate to the majority. 少数服从多数。

name: synthesis
interpret: n.综合，结合，综合体
example: 单词 synthesis 的例句||||We made a synthesis of their studies. 我们综合分析了他们的研究报告。||||The corporate planning department made a synthesis of all their studies for the future. 公司计划部综合分析了他们全部的对未来的研究报告。

name: subsidiary
interpret: adj.辅助的，附设的；n.子公司，附属机构
example: 单词 subsidiary 的例句||||The company placed much money in its foreign subsidiary. 那家公司投下巨额资金于国外的子公司。|||| This question is subsidiary to the previous one. 这个问题是辅助上一个问题的。

name: summit
interpret: n.最高点，峰顶；最高级会议；极点
example: 单词 summit 的例句||||They climbed up the mountain and reached the summit. 他们爬山，最终达到了山顶。||||The summit of the mountain is lost in the cloud and mist. 山顶隐没在云雾之中。

name: summon
interpret: vt.召唤，传唤，鼓起，振作，召集，召开
example: 单词 summon 的例句||||He could not summon the courage to tell them about it. 他鼓不起勇气告诉他们那件事。||||He pedaled off to summon a doctor. 他骑脚踏车去叫医生。

name: superficial
interpret: adj.肤浅的，浅薄的，表面的
example: 单词 superficial 的例句||||He has a superficial knowledge of this subject. 他对这门学科略知皮毛。||||A superficial injury is not serious. 表面的伤不太严重。

name: superiority
interpret: n.优越性，优势
example: 单词 superiority 的例句||||We believe in the superiority of this method over that one. 我们相信这种方法比那种方法优越。||||His air of calm superiority annoyed her intensely. 他不动声色的优越感让她极其烦恼。

name: supersonic
interpret: adj.超声的，超声速的
example: 单词 supersonic 的例句||||These planes travel at supersonic speeds. 这些飞机以超音速的速度飞行。||||Supersonic methods for determining the q value of material. 材料q值的超声波测定方法。

name: stride
interpret: vi.大踏步走，阔步行进；n.大步，步态
example: 单词 stride 的例句||||In a big stride he came out of the room. 他一个箭步出了房间。||||The boy walked with a confident manly stride. 这男孩以自信的男人步伐行走。

name: surplus
interpret: adj.过剩的，多余的；n.过剩，剩余额
example: 单词 surplus 的例句||||The manufacturers in some countries dumped their surplus commodities abroad. 一些国家的制造商向国外倾销过剩产品。||||The surplus steam was blown off through the pipes. 多余的蒸气通过管道放掉了。

name: transaction
interpret: n.处理，交易，相互作用
example: 单词 transaction 的例句||||He was twenty dollars in pocket by the transaction. 他在这笔生意中赚了20美元。||||He left the transaction of the matter to his secretary. 他把这件事交给秘书办理。

name: traverse
interpret: n.横贯，横木；v.横过，铭刻
example: 单词 traverse 的例句||||We traverse the desert by truck. 我们乘卡车横穿沙漠。||||I have no intention to traverse that ground in my present lecture. 在这次演讲中我不打算详细讨论这一点。

name: symmetry
interpret: n.对称（性），匀称，整齐
example: 单词 symmetry 的例句||||The butterfly is an example of symmetry. 蝴蝶是结构完全对称的一个例子。||||The human body has a symmetry that is basic to our sense of beauty. 人体的对称性构成我们审美观的基础。

name: tribute
interpret: n.颂词，称赞，(表示敬意的)礼物；贡品
example: 单词 tribute 的例句||||She accepted their tribute graciously. 她慈祥地接受了他们的致意。||||Many conquered nations had to pay tribute to the rulers of ancient Rome. 许多被征服的国家必须向古罗马的统治者朝贡。

name: trifle
interpret: n.无价值的东西、问题、行动；v.轻视，小看
example: 单词 trifle 的例句||||It's senseless to get angry over such a trifle. 不值得为这点小事惹气。||||This trifle developed itself into a serious problem. 这件小事已发展成一个很严重的问题。

name: trivial
interpret: adj.琐碎的，不重要的，无价值的
example: 单词 trivial 的例句||||Be patient. Don't lose your temper over trivial matters. 忍着点，别为了一点小事发火。||||It's useless to fire away with such trivial details. 喋喋不休地谈这些琐碎细节是无用的。

name: rebellion
interpret: n.造反，叛乱，反抗
example: 单词 rebellion 的例句||||The next year they rose up in rebellion. 第二年他们就揭竿起义了。||||The new government quickly suppressed the rebellion. 新政府迅速把叛乱镇压下去。

name: reap
interpret: vt. 收获，获得；收割 vi. 收割，收获
example: 单词 reap 的例句||||It is not easy to reap the harvest of my hard work. 获得自己辛勤工作的成果是不容易的。||||As a man sows, so he shall reap. 种瓜得瓜，种豆得豆。

name: sanction
interpret: vt.同意（某事），批准，认可；n.批准，国际制裁
example: 单词 sanction 的例句||||Prison is the best sanction against a crime like this. 为遏止这类罪行，监禁手段是上策。||||Official sanction has not yet been given. 尚未获得正式批准。

name: radiate
interpret: vt. 辐射；传播；流露；发射；广播；vi. 辐射；流露；发光；从中心向各方伸展；adj. 辐射状的，有射线的
example: 单词 radiate 的例句||||Avenues radiate from the Arc de Triomphe in Paris. 在巴黎，街道以凯旋门为中心向四方伸展。||||Light and heat radiate from the Sun. 光和热发自太阳。

name: quart
interpret: n.夸脱（液量、干量单位）
example: 单词 quart 的例句||||There is a quart of milk left in the pail. 桶里还剩下一夸脱牛奶。||||That glass will contain a quart of beer. 那个杯子可容一夸脱啤酒。

name: orthodox
interpret: adj.正统的，传统的，惯常的
example: 单词 orthodox 的例句||||They are orthodox Jews. 他们是正统的犹太教徒。||||His ideas are very orthodox. 他的思想非常合乎规范。

name: mortal
interpret: adj.终有一死的，致命的，不共戴天的；n.人
example: 单词 mortal 的例句||||He received a mortal wound soon after the battle began. 战争开始后不久，他就受到了致命的重伤。||||They are our mortal enemies. 他们是我们不共戴天的仇敌。

name: nonetheless
interpret: adv.尽管如此，依然，然而
example: 单词 nonetheless 的例句||||Though he's fool, I like him nonetheless. 虽然他很笨，我仍然喜欢他。||||His face is serious but nonetheless very friendly. 他一脸严肃，但还是非常友好。

name: odor
interpret: n.气味，香气，臭气
example: 单词 odor 的例句||||The whole herb has a characteristic taste and odor. 整株药草有种独特的味道和气味。||||He is in bad odor with his friends. 他在朋友中声誉不佳。

name: obscene
interpret: adj.（指思想、书籍等）猥亵的，淫秽的，下流的
example: 单词 obscene 的例句||||They have cut the obscene passages from the film to show it on television. 他们已把影片中的淫秽镜头剪去以便在电视上播映。||||He continued to use obscene language and also to make threats. 他仍然不住口地说些污言秽语, 而且还进行了威胁。

name: medieval
interpret: adj.中世纪的，中古（时代）的
example: 单词 medieval 的例句||||This is a medieval story. 这是一个中世纪的故事。|||| The museum has a fine collection of medieval ivories. 该博物馆收藏着一批精美的中世纪象牙制品。

name: inhabit
interpret: vt.居住于，（动物）栖居于
example: 单词 inhabit 的例句||||Thoughts inhabit his mind. 各种思想占据了他的心灵。||||Wild tribes still inhabit part of the Philippines. 菲律宾部分地区仍然居住着一些原始部落。

name: meadow
interpret: n.草地，牧草地
example: 单词 meadow 的例句||||The children ran free across the meadow. 孩子们在草地里自由地奔跑。||||The meadow is peopled with wild flowers. 草地长满了野花。

name: literacy
interpret: n.识字，有文化，读写能力
example: 单词 literacy 的例句||||I can't believe that he failed the literacy test. 我无法相信他识字测试不及格。||||The literacy rate there is the highest in Central America. 那里的识字率居中美洲之首。

name: lick
interpret: vt.舔（吃），打败，轻拍，吞卷；n.舔，少许
example: 单词 lick 的例句||||I think we could lick the best teams there. 我想我们能打败那儿最好的队。||||The house would look better with a lick of paint. 这房子稍加颜色就好看了。

name: guideline
interpret: n.指导原则，指导方针，准则
example: 单词 guideline 的例句||||They see the law only as a general guideline. 他们视法律为一般的准则。||||This is probably the most important interaction design guideline. 这基本上是最重要的交互设计指导准则。

name: foremost
interpret: adj.最初的，最前的，第一流的；adv.在最前
example: 单词 foremost 的例句||||He is considered the foremost British artist of this century. 他被认为是本世纪英国第一流的艺术家。|||| The premier occupies the foremost place in the world of politics. 首相是政界的首要人物。

name: grieve
interpret: vi.（for，over）感到悲痛；vt.(使)伤心
example: 单词 grieve 的例句||||Be sure and not grieve. 一定不要伤心。||||What the eye does not see, the heart does not grieve over. 眼不见，心不烦。

name: hinder
interpret: adj.后面的；v.阻碍，打扰
example: 单词 hinder 的例句||||Don't hinder me in my work. 不要妨碍我的工作。|||| Nobody wants to hinder your doing that. 谁也不想阻止你做那件事。

name: glitter
interpret: vi.闪光(耀)；n.闪光，灿烂光辉，耀眼，辉煌
example: 单词 glitter 的例句||||The child was attracted by the glitter of the Christmas tree decorations. 这孩子被圣诞树上闪耀的装饰物吸引住了。||||Beneath its surface glitter, the fashion industry is a tough place to work in. 时装业表面上光彩迷人，但其实是个辛苦的行业。

name: consciousness
interpret: n.意识，觉悟，知觉
example: 单词 consciousness 的例句||||The experience helped to change her social consciousness. 这种经验有助于改变她的社会意识。||||He lost consciousness at the first whiff of ether. 他一嗅到乙醚便失去了知觉。

name: consequent
interpret: adj.作为结果（或后果）的，随之发生的
example: 单词 consequent 的例句||||This fall of prices is consequent on the rise in production. 这次价格下降是生产提高的结果。||||His long illness and consequent absence put him far behind in his work. 他因病缺席很久，耽误了很多课程。

name: diminish
interpret: vi.变少，变小，降低；vt.减少，减小，降低
example: 单词 diminish 的例句||||We should try to diminish the cost of production. 我们应尽力减少生产成本。||||He likes to diminish the skill of others. 他喜欢贬低别人的技术。

name: console
interpret: n.控制台，仪表板，落地柜；vt.安慰，慰问
example: 单词 console 的例句||||We tried to console her when her dog died. 她的狗死后，我们尽力安慰她。||||The console is just like a typewriter. 控制台就像一台打字机。

name: diplomatic
interpret: adj.外交的，从事外交的，策略的，有手腕的
example: 单词 diplomatic 的例句||||There are certain forms that must be followed in diplomatic circles. 在外交界有一些礼节是必须遵守的。||||You must be more diplomatic in handling the situation. 你在处理这一情况时，必须圆滑。

name: constitute
interpret: vt.组成，构成，形成，设立，建立，任命
example: 单词 constitute 的例句||||A whole consists of parts, the parts constitute the whole. 整体由部分组成，部分构成整体。||||The company will constitute you captain of the ship. 公司将任命你担任这艘船的船长。

name: discern
interpret: vt. 识别；领悟，认识 vi. 看清楚，辨别
example: 单词 discern 的例句||||Some people find it difficult to discern blue from green. 有些人很难分辨蓝色与绿色。||||The man couldn't discern between right and wrong. 那人是非分辨不清。

name: consumption
interpret: n.消费，消耗，消费额，消耗量，结核病
example: 单词 consumption 的例句||||Consumption of oil has declined in recent years. 石油消耗量在最近几年下降了。||||The meat was condemned as unfit for human consumption. 这种肉已被宣布不适宜人们食用。

name: contend
interpret: vi.竞争，搏斗，声称，主张；vt.坚持主张
example: 单词 contend 的例句||||The firm is too small to contend against large international companies. 这家公司太小，无法与国际性的大公司竞争。||||Let a hundred flowers blossom, let a hundred schools of thought contend. 百花齐放，百家争鸣。

name: customary
interpret: adj.习惯上的，惯常的，合乎习俗的
example: 单词 customary 的例句||||He makes his customary visit every week. 他每星期都按照惯例造访一次。||||It is customary with me to do so. 这样做是我的习惯。

name: dispatch
interpret: vt.派遣；n.急件，快信，新闻报道，派遣
example: 单词 dispatch 的例句||||We must ask someone to carry a dispatch from Rome to London. 我们得派人把急件由罗马送往伦敦。||||I'll advise you of the dispatch of the goods. 我会通知你们货物的发运情况。

name: displace
interpret: vt.取代，迫使...离开家园，使离开原位
example: 单词 displace 的例句||||The extraordinary thing was that French did not displace English. 奇特的是，法语没有取代英语。||||At present, obviously, nevertheless, he was not likely to displace himself. 但时至今日，很清楚，他不可能再迁徙了。

name: disregard
interpret: vt.不理会，漠视；n.忽视，漠视
example: 单词 disregard 的例句||||You can't just disregard the security problem? 你可不能忽视安全问题？ ||||He did it in disregard of any advice. 他不顾一切劝告做了这件事。

name: dissipate
interpret: vi.消散，消失；vt.使消散，使消失，浪费
example: 单词 dissipate 的例句||||Don't dissipate your efforts. 不要浪费你的精力。|||| The body must dissipate heat as fast as it produces. 人体散发热量必须和产生热量一样快。

name: diversion
interpret: n.转移，转向，消遣，娱乐，临时绕行路
example: 单词 diversion 的例句||||Golf is my father's favourite diversion. 高尔夫球是我父亲最喜欢的娱乐。||||The magician's talk created a diversion of attention. 魔术师的讲话分散了人们的注意力。

name: divert
interpret: vt.使转向，使改道，转移（注意力），使娱乐
example: 单词 divert 的例句||||The trucks were forced to divert to another road. 卡车被迫改道而行。||||Such games divert the children. 此种游戏孩子们感兴趣。

name: episode
interpret: n.（作品的一段）情节，插曲，系列事件中之一
example: 单词 episode 的例句||||The episode was a huge embarrassment for all concerned. 这段小插曲令所有有关人员都感到非常尴尬。|||| This episode remains sharply engraved on my mind. 这段经历至今仍深深地铭刻在我的心中。

name: distort
interpret: vt.歪曲，曲解，扭曲，使变形；vi.变形
example: 单词 distort 的例句||||How dare he distort the facts so brazenly? 他怎么敢如此肆无忌惮地歪曲事实？||||This caused the sound to distort. 这导致了声音的失真。

name: extract
interpret: vt.取出，提取，获得，摘录；n.摘录，提出物
example: 单词 extract 的例句||||The article was a choice extract from her writings. 这篇文章是从她的著作中摘录出来的精粹。||||We can extract oil from olive. 我们可以从橄榄中榨油。

name: escort
interpret: n.护卫者，护送者；vt.护送，护卫
example: 单词 escort 的例句||||The prisoner was taken under escort to the jail. 罪犯被押送到监狱。||||Her escort to the party was a tall young man. 陪同她参加晚会的是一位高个子男青年。

name: hospitality
interpret: n.好客，殷勤；adj.（气候等）宜人，适宜
example: 单词 hospitality 的例句||||He welcomed you to enjoy his hospitality. 他欢迎你去做客。||||Thank you for your kind hospitality. 谢谢你的盛情款待。

name: hostage
interpret: n.人质，抵押品
example: 单词 hostage 的例句||||One group claimed to have executed the American hostage. 一个组织声称已经处决了那名美国人质。||||Have you read the article about the rescue of the hostage? 你看了关于营救人质的文章了吗？

name: hound
interpret: n.猎狗，卑鄙的人；vt.用猎狗追，追逐
example: 单词 hound 的例句||||The hound found the trail of the rabbit. 猎狗发现了兔子的踪迹。||||The police have promised to hound down those responsible for the explosion. 警方已保证要追查此次爆炸事件有责任的人员。

name: fringe
interpret: n.边缘；（窗帘）缘饰，额前垂发；vt.饰...的边
example: 单词 fringe 的例句||||The girl wears her hair in a fringe. 那女孩留着刘海。||||This is an enormous field of which l can touch only the fringe. 这是一个很广阔的领域，我在这里只能谈个大概。

name: inference
interpret: n.推断结果，结论，推论，推理，推断
example: 单词 inference 的例句||||The inference I've drawn from his lateness is he overslept. 从他来晚我得出的结论是他睡过头了。||||You seemed to know about this book, and by inference I thought you had read it. 你好像了解这本书，因此我推断你已读过它了。

name: infinite
interpret: adj.无限的，无穷的，无边无际的
example: 单词 infinite 的例句||||The universe seems infinite. 宇宙似乎是无限的。|||| The war brought infinite harm to the nation. 战争给这个国家带来了无穷的灾难。

name: furious
interpret: adj.狂怒的，暴怒的，强烈的，激烈的
example: 单词 furious 的例句||||I was furious at his making such an accusation. 我对他的这种责备非常气愤。||||His wife was furious with him. 他妻子对他大发雷霆。

name: humidity
interpret: n.湿度，潮湿，湿气
example: 单词 humidity 的例句||||The house is not comfortable tonight, because of the high humidity. 由于湿度高，今晚屋子里不舒服。||||It's difficult to work because of the humidity. 由于空气潮湿，工作很困难。

name: ingenious
interpret: adj.设计独特的，巧妙的，善于创造发明的
example: 单词 ingenious 的例句||||Try to think of unusual and ingenious solutions. 尽量想想不同寻常的、巧妙的解决方法。||||The director used ingenious devices to keep the audience in suspense. 导演用巧妙手法引起观众的悬念。

name: inherent
interpret: adj.(in)内在的，固有的，生来就有的
example: 单词 inherent 的例句||||The desire for freedom is inherent in us all. 对自由的渴望是我们所有人的天性。||||Weight is an inherent property of matter. 重量是物质固有的特性。

name: intervene
interpret: vi.干涉，干预，干扰，阻挠
example: 单词 intervene 的例句||||When riot broke out, the police were obliged to intervene. 发生暴乱时，警察有责任干预。||||You don't intervene between those two drunks. 你不要在那两个酒鬼之间进行调解。

name: hypothesis
interpret: n.假说，假设，(无根据的)猜测，揣测
example: 单词 hypothesis 的例句||||We have proved the hypothesis. 我们已经证明了这种假设。||||The results confirmed his hypothesis on the use of modal verbs. 结果证实了他的关于情态动词用法的假设。

name: invariably
interpret: adv.不变地，始终如一地，总是
example: 单词 invariably 的例句||||A unity invariably tends to break up into different parts. 统一体总要分解为不同部分的。||||We always invariably support him. 我们一直始终不变地支持他。

name: innovation
interpret: n.改革，革新，新观念，新方法，新发明
example: 单词 innovation 的例句||||There are all sorts of possibilities for technical innovation. 技术革新的门道很多。|||| An enterprise should encourage innovation. 企业应鼓励创新。

name: innumerable
interpret: adj.无数的，不计其数的
example: 单词 innumerable 的例句||||The innumerable stars in the sky are too far from us. 天上无数的星星离我们太远了。||||Technological innovations have brought innumerable benefits. 技术革新已经带来了无穷的好处。

name: irrespective
interpret: adj.（of）不考虑的，不顾及的
example: 单词 irrespective 的例句||||He is going to buy it, irrespective of what you say. 不管你说什么，他是买定了。||||We will have the work done, irrespective of cost. 不管花多大代价，我们也得要把这项工作办好。

name: irritate
interpret: vt.使恼怒，使烦燥，使不适，使疼痛
example: 单词 irritate 的例句||||Don't irritate her, she's on a short fuse today. 别惹她，她今天动不动就发火。||||These tight shoes irritate my toes. 我的鞋太紧，夹痛我的脚趾。

name: instantaneous
interpret: adj.立即的，瞬间发生的
example: 单词 instantaneous 的例句||||He had an instantaneous response. 他立刻作了反应。||||She accidentally swallowed the poison and death was instantaneous. 她意外地吞下了毒药，当即就死去了。

name: multitude
interpret: n.众多，大量，大群，大众
example: 单词 multitude 的例句||||He has a multitude of friend. 他有许多朋友。||||A growing economy covers a multitude of sins for the government. 蓬勃的经济为政府掩盖种种见不得人的东西。

name: instrumental
interpret: adj.仪器的，器械的，乐器的，起作用的，有帮助的
example: 单词 instrumental 的例句||||It is an instrumental work. 这是一部可以用乐器演奏的作品。||||He was instrumental in catching the criminal. 在捉拿那个罪犯的过程中，他起了作用。

name: insulate
interpret: vt.使绝缘，使隔热，使隔音，隔离，使隔绝
example: 单词 insulate 的例句||||The function of a mammal's fur is to insulate the body. 哺乳动物皮毛的功能在于使身体保温。||||The ceiling tiles help to insulate a room. 那天花板瓦能使房间隔热。

name: muscular
interpret: adj.肌肉发达的，强壮的，（有关）肌（肉）的
example: 单词 muscular 的例句||||He is a muscular young man. 他是个健壮的年轻人。|||| The player is tall and muscular. 那名运动员身高力大。

name: integral
interpret: adj.必不可少的，构成整体所必需的
example: 单词 integral 的例句||||She is our best player, who is integral to our team. 她是我们最好的球员，我们队离不开她。||||That's an integral part of the country. 那是构成国家所必需的一部分。

name: mute
interpret: n.哑子，默音字母，弱音器；adj.哑的，无声的，沉默的；vt.减音，减弱；vi.（鸟）排泄
example: 单词 mute 的例句||||He is mute on the subject of social system. 他对社会制度的问题保持沉默。||||Her daughter was mute after a serious illness. 她的女儿在一场重病之后失去了说话能力。

name: integrate
interpret: vt. 使…完整；使…成整体；求…的积分；表示…的总和 vi. 求积分；取消隔离；成为一体 adj. 整合的；完全的
example: 单词 integrate 的例句||||A customs union would integrate the economies of these countries. 关税联盟会把这些国家的经济紧密结合在一起。||||We must integrate theory with practice. 我们必须把理论与实际结合起来。

name: minimize
interpret: vt.使减（缩）小到最低，极力贬低，最低估计
example: 单词 minimize 的例句||||To minimize the risk of burglary, install a good alarm system. 安装可靠的报警设备以减低被盗的风险。|||| To minimize the public expenditure of this country. 把该国的财政支出减少到最低限度。

name: integrity
interpret: n.正直，诚实，诚恳，完整，完全，完善
example: 单词 integrity 的例句||||The country is fighting to preserve its territorial integrity. 该国在为保持领土的完整而进行斗争。||||He is a man of the highest integrity. 他是个极其正直的人。

name: overwhelming
interpret: adj.势不可挡的，压倒的，无法抵抗的
example: 单词 overwhelming 的例句||||The flood was overwhelming and the city was soon drowned. 洪水来势凶猛，很快这个城市就被淹没了。||||The act was adopted by an overwhelming majority. 该法案以压倒多数通过。

name: perplex
interpret: vt.使困惑，使费解，使复杂化
example: 单词 perplex 的例句||||I have no wish to perplex the issue. 我不想使问题复杂化。||||This problem is hard enough to perplex, even the teacher. 这个问题确实很难，以至于老师都迷惑不解。

name: mobilize
interpret: vt.动员，调动，鼓动起；vi.动员起来
example: 单词 mobilize 的例句||||The troops received orders to mobilize. 部队接到动员令。||||He is trying to mobilize all the supporters. 他正在竭力把所有的支持者动员起来。

name: mock
interpret: n.嘲笑，戏弄，模仿；adj.假的，伪造的；vt.嘲弄，模仿，轻视；vi.嘲弄
example: 单词 mock 的例句||||Those who mock history will be mocked by history. 嘲弄历史的人必将被历史所嘲弄。||||The students have done mock A levels at school. 学生们在学校参加过模拟高级考试。

name: persist
interpret: vi. 存留，坚持；持续，固执 vt. 坚持说，反复说
example: 单词 persist 的例句||||The bad weather will persist all over the country. 这种坏天气将在全国各地持续下去。||||His strength of will enabled him to persist. 他的意志力使他能坚持下去。

name: pore
interpret: n.毛孔，细孔；vi.(over)仔细阅读，审视
example: 单词 pore 的例句||||He was sweating through every pore. 他每个毛孔都在冒汗。||||I see him chafe and fret at every pore. 我看见他非常暴躁。

name: petition
interpret: n.请愿书，申请书，诉状；v.请愿，正式请求
example: 单词 petition 的例句||||Thousands of citizens subscribed the petition. 几千名公民在请愿书上签名。||||The number of signers of the petition for a new school snowballed. 要求增设新学校而签名的人像滚雪球似的越来越多。

name: monopoly
interpret: n.垄断，专卖，垄断物（商品），专卖商品
example: 单词 monopoly 的例句||||His monopoly of shipbuilding in that country has been established. 他对那个国家造船业的垄断已经建立起来。||||In many countries, tobacco is a government monopoly. 在许多国家, 烟草由政府专营。

name: practicable
interpret: adj.可实行的，能用的
example: 单词 practicable 的例句||||Please weigh the above points and see if they are practicable. 以上几点意见是否可行，请酌定。|||| Production plans must be practicable. 生产计划要订得落实。

name: mortgage
interpret: n.抵押，抵押贷款；vt.抵押
example: 单词 mortgage 的例句||||He's having a lot of trouble paying his mortgage every month. 他付每月的抵押借款利息有很大的困难。|||| The bank refused to accept any mortgage on land. 银行拒绝接受任何土地抵押。

name: precede
interpret: vt. 领先，在…之前；优于，高于 vi. 领先，在前面
example: 单词 precede 的例句||||Agricultural development simply must precede economic development. 农业的发展必须在整个经济发展中处于领先地位。||||Attributive adjectives precede the noun. 定语形容词位于名词前。

name: predominant
interpret: adj.占主导地位的，显著的
example: 单词 predominant 的例句||||Love of peace is the predominant feeling of many people today. 爱好和平在今天是许多人的主要情感。||||The predominant feature of his character was pride. 他的性格中主要的特点是骄傲。

name: plague
interpret: n.瘟疫，鼠疫，祸患，灾难；v.烦扰，使痛苦
example: 单词 plague 的例句||||Plague was then prevailing in that city. 当时瘟疫正在该城流行。||||The plague once could wipe out a village. 鼠疫曾一度可以夺走整个村庄村民的生命。

name: tropic
interpret: n.回归线，[the T-s]热带地区
example: 单词 tropic 的例句||||She sorted out her things for tropic travel. 她整理热带旅行的东西。||||He is making a study of that tropic plant. 他正在对那种热带植物进行研究。

name: automation
interpret: n.自动化（技术），自动操作
example: 单词 automation 的例句||||Automation will mean the loss of many jobs in this factory. 自动化将意味着这个工厂要减少许多工作职位。||||Automation has helped to increase production. 自动化促进了生产的发展。

name: assimilate
interpret: vt. 吸收；使同化；把…比作；使相似 vi. 吸收；同化
example: 单词 assimilate 的例句||||Some foreigners assimilate easily into our way of life. 有些外国人很容易被我们的生活方式同化。||||It is difficult to assimilate a lot of information. 难于在较短时间内摄取许多信息。

name: asset
interpret: n.有价值的资源，优点，长处；财产，资产
example: 单词 asset 的例句||||Ability to get along with people is an asset in business. 在商业界善跟别人相处是可贵的优点。|||| Intelligence was her main asset. 智力是她的主要财富。

name: articulate
interpret: adj.口齿伶俐的，发音清晰的；v.清楚地讲话
example: 单词 articulate 的例句||||That man is not very articulate. 那人口齿不清。|||| Articulate speech is very important. 清楚的表达能力是非常重要的。

name: transient
interpret: adj.短暂的，转瞬即逝的，临时的，暂住的
example: 单词 transient 的例句||||Her feeling of depression was transient. 她的压抑心情一会儿就过去了。||||In most cases, pain is transient. 大多数情况下，疼痛是短暂的。

name: vulnerable
interpret: adj.易受伤的，脆弱的，易受攻击的
example: 单词 vulnerable 的例句||||He volunteered to protect her as she looked so vulnerable. 她看上去很脆弱，他就主动去保护她。||||The company is in an economically vulnerable position. 该公司目前经济状况不稳定。

name: timber
interpret: n.木材，原木，大木料，栋木
example: 单词 timber 的例句||||These trees need more time to grow into useful timber. 这些树不够年头，还没成材呢。||||The timber is graded according to its thickness. 木材按厚度分级。

name: thorn
interpret: n.刺，荆棘，带刺小灌木
example: 单词 thorn 的例句||||The little boy stepped on a sharp thorn. 那小男孩踩着了一根尖刺。||||The dog had a thorn in its pad. 这只狗的爪垫上扎了根刺。

name: verdict
interpret: n.裁决，结论，定论，判断
example: 单词 verdict 的例句||||The verdict of the jury was given in his favour. 陪审团作出了对他有利的结论。||||Not satisfied with the verdict, they decided to make an appeal. 他们不服判决，决定申诉。

name: upgrade
interpret: vt.提高，加强，改善；n.提高，改善
example: 单词 upgrade 的例句||||We need to upgrade the status of teachers. 我们需要提升老师的地位。||||To upgrade a clerk to manager. 将办事员提升为经理。

name: undermine
interpret: vt.暗中破坏，逐渐削弱，侵蚀…的基础
example: 单词 undermine 的例句||||She tried to undermine our friendship. 她试图破坏我们的友谊。||||Rivers undermine their banks. 河水冲刷堤基。

name: republican
interpret: n.拥护共和政体的人； adj.共和政体的，（Republican）共和党人，（Republican）共和党的
example: 单词 republican 的例句||||Some families have been Republican for generations. 有些家庭世代都支持共和党。||||A third candidate has entered the contest for the Republican nomination. 第三个候选人已经加入角逐共和党提名的行列。

name: reproach
interpret: n.责备，耻辱；v.责备，申斥
example: 单词 reproach 的例句||||She got a sharp reproach from her boss. 她受到了上司的严厉训斥。||||His conduct has been beyond reproach. 他的行为无可指责。

name: simulate
interpret: vt.模仿，模拟，假装，冒充
example: 单词 simulate 的例句||||The wood had been painted to simulate stone. 木头上刷了漆以看起来像块石头。||||A sheet of metal was shaken to simulate the noise of thunder. 猛力抖动金属片以模仿雷声。

name: remnant
interpret: n.残留部分，遗迹；adj.剩余的，残余的
example: 单词 remnant 的例句||||He is suffering from some remnant feeling of disgrace. 他还在为残留的耻辱感到苦恼。||||She bought a remnant of silk at a bargain. 她廉价购得一块零头丝布。

name: shrewd
interpret: adj.机灵的，敏锐的，精明的
example: 单词 shrewd 的例句||||His answer to the journalist is a shrewd one. 他回答记者的问题是很机敏的。||||He's too shrewd to be trusted in business matters. 他太狡猾，生意上不宜信任。

name: recruit
interpret: n.招聘，新兵，新成员；v.恢复，补充，招募
example: 单词 recruit 的例句||||The country's first act would be to recruit for the navy. 国家的第一个行动是为海军征募新兵。||||This is a nationwide campaign to recruit women into trade unions. 这是一次吸收妇女参加工会的全国性运动。

name: scorn
interpret: n./vt.轻蔑，鄙视，拒绝，不屑（做）
example: 单词 scorn 的例句||||He looked at me with scorn. 他轻蔑地看了看我。|||| You've no right to scorn a poor girl. 你没有任何理由看不起一个贫穷的姑娘。

name: recession
interpret: n.（工商业的）衷退（期），萧条（期）
example: 单词 recession 的例句||||Manufacturing fell sharply under the impact of the recession. 受到经济萧条的影响，制造业急剧衰退。||||A rise in interest rates plunged Britain deeper into recession. 利率的提高导致英国经济更加萧条。

name: heir
interpret: n.继承人，接班人
example: 单词 heir 的例句||||The King's eldest son is the heir to the throne. 国王的长子是王位的继承人。||||We don't recognised him to be the lawful heir. 我们不承认他为合法继承人。

name: feeble
interpret: adj.虚弱的，衰弱的，无力的，无效的，无益的
example: 单词 feeble 的例句||||She made a feeble effort to get to school on time. 她努力想按时赶到学校，但未成功。||||An old or sick person is often feeble. 老人或病人往往很虚弱。

name: erroneous
interpret: adj.错误的，不正确的
example: 单词 erroneous 的例句||||I thought my answer was correct, but it was erroneous. 我原以为我的答案是对的, 可结果却是错的。|||| He has an erroneous opinion about the problem. 他对那个问题有错误的看法。

name: ensue
interpret: vi.接着发生，接踵而来，因而产生；vt.追求
example: 单词 ensue 的例句||||Who knows what a bother may ensue from overpopulation? 谁知道人口过剩会带来什么麻烦？||||Let him seek peace and ensue it? 让他去追求和平并为和平而奔波吧？

name: despise
interpret: vt.看不起，轻视，鄙视
example: 单词 despise 的例句||||Don't cheat at exams or others will despise you. 考试不要作弊！否则别人会瞧不起你。||||No one will despise you. 没有人鄙视你。

name: casualty
interpret: n.严重伤亡事故，伤亡人员，受害者
example: 单词 casualty 的例句||||Mr. Jones was the first casualty of the firm's cut-backs. 琼斯先生在公司裁员中是第一个受害者。|||| Casualty lists were published the day after the train accident. 伤亡名单在火车意外事故的第二天就公布了。

name: bizarre
interpret: adj.奇形怪状的，怪诞的
example: 单词 bizarre 的例句||||They saw a bizarre animal in the lake. 他们在湖中看见一个奇怪的动物。||||The building was of bizarre construction. 这建筑构造奇异。

name: alliance
interpret: n.同盟，同盟国，结盟，联姻
example: 单词 alliance 的例句||||China will not enter into alliance with any big power. 中国不同任何大国结盟。||||The new alliance was very much in evidence. 新的联盟上星期很引人注目。

name: administer
interpret: vt. 管理；执行；给予；vi. 给予帮助；执行遗产管理人的职责；担当管理人
example: 单词 administer 的例句||||It takes brains to administer upon a large corporation. 管理一家大公司需要智慧。||||They had the right to administer their own internal affairs. 他们有权料理自己的事务。

name: mutter
interpret: vi. 咕哝；喃喃自语；vt. 咕哝；抱怨地说；低声含糊地说 n. 咕哝；喃喃低语
example: 单词 mutter 的例句||||I heard a mutter of discontent. 我听到有人小声咕哝着表示不满。||||Don't mutter when they are studying. 当他们学习时不要轻声低语。

name: contempt
interpret: n.轻视，藐视，受辱，丢脸
example: 单词 contempt 的例句||||She looked at him with immediate and undisguised contempt. 她用毫不掩饰的轻蔑眼光看着他。||||He refused to answer in contempt of the rules of the court. 他藐视法院规章，拒绝回答。

name: continuity
interpret: n.连贯性，连续性，持续性
example: 单词 continuity 的例句||||There is no continuity between the three parts of the book. 这本书的三个部分之间没有连贯性。|||| Unfortunately, no questions from the audience broke the continuity of his harangue. 令人遗憾的是，没有听众提出问题来打断他的高谈阔论。

name: disclose
interpret: vt.揭露，泄露，透露
example: 单词 disclose 的例句||||Science can disclose the mysteries of nature. 科学能解开自然界的奥秘。||||Neither side would disclose details of the transaction. 双方均不肯披露交易细节。

name: convict
interpret: n.囚犯，罪犯；v.使...确信自己犯错，宣告...有罪，使...知罪
example: 单词 convict 的例句||||I have all the evidence necessary to convict this young criminal now. 我掌握一切必要的证据来给这个年轻犯人定罪。||||It was difficult to convict him of the falsity of his beliefs. 难以使他认识到他信仰的虚假性。

name: cordial
interpret: adj.（指感情或行为上）热忱的，诚恳的
example: 单词 cordial 的例句||||The conversation was carried on in a cordial and friendly atmosphere. 会谈是在亲切友好的气氛中进行的。||||The meeting of the old classmates was extremely cordial. 老同学聚会在一起，分外亲热。

name: compile
interpret: vt.编辑，编制，搜集
example: 单词 compile 的例句||||It takes years of hard work to compile a good dictionary. 编辑一部好词典需要数年的艰苦工作。||||In order to compile the military history, he has read many materials. 他为了编写军史而查阅了很多材料。

name: cripple
interpret: n.跛子，伤残人（或动物）；vt.使跛，严重削弱
example: 单词 cripple 的例句||||It is wrong to make fun of a cripple. 嘲笑残疾人是不对的。||||His first task was to cripple the enemy at sea. 他的首要任务是使海上的敌人失去战斗力。

name: confer
interpret: vt.授予（某人）（学位或头衔）；vi.讨论，商谈
example: 单词 confer 的例句||||They often confer together. 他们经常在一起协商。||||I'll confer with him on the subject. 我将和他商议这件事。

name: intrinsic
interpret: adj.固有的，本质的，内在的
example: 单词 intrinsic 的例句||||The intrinsic worth of the pen is 30 yuan. 这支钢笔本身价值是30元。||||The character is intrinsic. 性格是内在的。

name: proclaim
interpret: vt.宣告，宣布，公布，声明，表明
example: 单词 proclaim 的例句||||His manners proclaim him a scholar. 从他的举止可以看出他是一个学者。||||His classic boyish looks seemed to proclaim his good humour and openness. 他的长相非常孩子气，显得性情很好且诚实坦率。

name: rig
interpret: n.装备，帆具，服装；v. 装配，装扮，垄断
example: 单词 rig 的例句||||They rig their domestic markets in favour of local businesses. 他们操纵国内市场以使当地企业受益。||||Our camping rig includes cooking pots and sleeping bags. 我们的野营装备包括锅子和睡袋。

name: sparkle
interpret: vi.闪，焕发；n.闪光，闪烁，活力
example: 单词 sparkle 的例句||||Dewdrops sparkle in the morning Sun. 露珠在早晨的阳光下闪着光。||||There was a sudden sparkle as her diamond ring caught the light. 当她的钻石戒指遇到光时，有阵突然的闪耀。

name: speciality
interpret: n.专业，专长，名产，特产
example: 单词 speciality 的例句||||Silk is the speciality of this village. 丝绸是这村子的特产。||||His speciality is English literature. 他的专业是英国文学。

name: sponge
interpret: n.海绵，海绵状的东西；v.用海绵擦拭，吸收掉， 抹掉
example: 单词 sponge 的例句||||The child is screwing water out of a sponge. 小孩正把海绵中的水挤出来。||||You should try to sponge out the memory of the accident. 你该努力抹除那次事故的记忆。

name: spontaneous
interpret: adj.自发的，不由自主的
example: 单词 spontaneous 的例句||||The eruption of a volcano is spontaneous. 火山的爆发是自发的。||||Spontaneous applause broke out as soon as she finished speaking. 她一讲完，大家不约而同都鼓起掌来。

name: tumble
interpret: vi.跌倒，摔下，翻滚，暴跌；n.跌(摔)倒
example: 单词 tumble 的例句||||Children tumble over each other in play. 孩子们玩耍时相互连身翻滚。||||He took a tumble down the stairs. 他摔下了楼梯。

name: turbulent
interpret: adj.动荡的，混乱的；汹涌的，狂暴的
example: 单词 turbulent 的例句||||The current is turbulent. 水势汹涌。||||The present international situation remains tense and turbulent. 当前的国际局势依然紧张动荡。

name: strategic
interpret: adj.战略（上）的，战略上重要的
example: 单词 strategic 的例句||||The army moved for strategic reasons. 军队作了战略转移。||||The bridge is of strategic importance to us. 这座桥对我们至关重要。

name: sustain
interpret: vt.保持，供养，维持，支持，经受
example: 单词 sustain 的例句||||During the war we had just enough food to sustain us. 战争期间，我们的食物仅够维持生活。||||These four posts sustain the entire building. 这四根柱子支撑着整座建筑物。

name: surname
interpret: n.姓；vt.冠姓
example: 单词 surname 的例句||||Her first name is Sheila and her surname is Kane. 她姓凯恩，名叫希拉。||||Wang is a very common Chinese surname. 王是一个很常见的中国姓。

name: ultimately
interpret: adv.最后地，最终地，首要地，基本地
example: 单词 ultimately 的例句||||It was a demeaning and ultimately frustrating experience. 那是一次有失颜面并且令人沮丧至极的经历。||||Vitamin C deficiency can ultimately lead to scurvy. 缺乏维生素C最终能导致坏血病。

name: refuge
interpret: n.避难（处），庇护（所）；v.庇护，避难（所）
example: 单词 refuge 的例句||||They took refuge in a cave yesterday. 他们昨天是在一个洞里避难的。||||We took refuge in the lee of the wall. 我们在墙的背风处暂避。

name: needless
interpret: adj.不必，无须，不必要的，无用的
example: 单词 needless 的例句||||Needless to say, I agree. 无须说，我是同意的。||||It is needless to add that you are in want of a second. 你需要一个助手，那是不必说的。

name: grammatical
interpret: adj.语法的，符合语法规则的
example: 单词 grammatical 的例句||||His composition is excellent except for some grammatical mistakes. 他的作文写得很好，只有几处语法错误。||||He can barely form a grammatical sentence. 他几乎造不出合乎语法的句子。

name: deduce
interpret: vt.演绎，推论，推断
example: 单词 deduce 的例句||||We can deduce a conclusion from the premise. 我们可以从这个前提推出结论。||||I imagine that you may deduce an apt moral from my tale. 我觉得你也许能从我的际遇中引出恰当的教训。

name: childish
interpret: adj.孩子的，孩子气的，幼稚的
example: 单词 childish 的例句||||The little girl spoke in a high childish voice. 这个小女孩用尖尖的童声讲话。||||We eventually ran out of patience with his childish behaviour. 我们终于对他幼稚的行为忍无可忍。

name: dim
interpret: adj.昏暗的；朦胧的；v.(使)暗淡，(使)模糊
example: 单词 dim 的例句||||The light is too dim for me to read easily. 光线太暗，我很难阅读。||||I was so tired that my eyesight grew dim. 我太累了，眼睛有点发花。

name: dew
interpret: n.露，露水
example: 单词 dew 的例句||||His new shoes were wet with dew. 他的那双新鞋被露水弄湿了。||||The dew on the branches drizzled our hair and shoulders. 枝头上的露珠润湿了我们的头发和双肩。

name: brim
interpret: n.帽檐，（容器的）边，边缘；vi.注满，充溢
example: 单词 brim 的例句||||The glass was full to the brim. 玻璃杯中的液体已满到要溢出来了。||||She was filled to the brim with happiness. 她充满了幸福。

name: deceit
interpret: n.不老实，欺骗，欺诈，欺骗行为
example: 单词 deceit 的例句||||The boy's deceit made his mother very unhappy. 这小孩的欺骗行为使他母亲非常不愉快。||||The trader was truthful and without deceit. 这位商人很可信，童叟无欺。
